analyzed: lus las 'byung ba'i srin bu bong chung ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Small insects emerge from their bodies.

original: de las sdug bsngal ches mang ba 'byung ba ni sems can dmyal pa dag bsdus nas de dag mngon pa med par byed de /🔽phan tshun me 'bar ba'i phreng bas lus yongs su gdungs pa dag yun ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par @358a *//
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal ches mang ba 'byung ba ni sems can dmyal pa dag bsdus nas de dag mngon pa med par byed de / phan tshun me 'bar ba'i phreng bas lus yongs su gdungs pa dag yun ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par @358a *//
translated: The suffering that arises from them is much greater. The hell beings gather together and are consumed by the insects.🔽They are tormented by the blazing garlands of fire that spread from one to another.

original: ma byas pa de srid du lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sreg go /
analyzed: ma byas pa de srid du lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sreg go /
translated: For as long as their negative acts have not been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted, they will continue to burn for years that cannot be calculated.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they finally escape this hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs lnga brgyar ri gseb tu yi dvags khab mgrin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs lnga brgyar ri gseb tu yi dvags khab mgrin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will, as an effect that accords with their causal actions, be born five hundred times as a ghost with a needle-like throat in the mountains.

original: tshe rabs lnga brgyar rgya mtsho'i so'i 'og gi chu grang mo ba tshva'i chu'i nang gi nyar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar rgya mtsho'i so'i 'og gi chu grang mo ba tshva'i chu'i nang gi nyar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For five hundred lives they will be born as fish in the cold water beneath the ocean’s shores, in water that is like caustic soda.

original: de dag de las thar nas gal te brgya la gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na de tshal na spyod cing tshal gyi nang na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de dag de las thar nas gal te brgya la gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na de tshal na spyod cing tshal gyi nang na gnas pa'am /
translated: “If, with hundreds of hardships, they should escape and be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will live in a forest, in the middle of a forest,

original: nags khrod na 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: nags khrod na 'tsho ba'am /
translated: or in a jungle.

original: dbul zhing de tshal gyi mes sreg par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dbul zhing de tshal gyi mes sreg par 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: They will be poor and will be burned by forest fires.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba skye bo thams cad sreg pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba skye bo thams cad sreg pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Heat, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive a neighboring realm of the great hell known as All Beings Burned.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba snga ma bzhin kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba snga ma bzhin kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: “What are they? They are killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, drinking alcohol, and lying, as before.

original: log par lta ba'ang thos pa ngan pas rmongs pa lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyi chad pas rnam par rmongs pa /
analyzed: log par lta ba'ang thos pa ngan pas rmongs pa lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyi chad pas rnam par rmongs pa /
translated: “As for wrong view, one may be confused by bad learning and deluded by physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: @358b rtag tu chad pa rnam pa gsum gyis nyam thag pa /
analyzed: @358b rtag tu chad pa rnam pa gsum gyis nyam thag pa /
translated: One is always tormented by these three kinds of actions.

original: log par lta ba'ang mtshungs par spyod pa dag tshal lam /
analyzed: log par lta ba'ang mtshungs par spyod pa dag tshal lam /
translated: “As for wrong view, one may practice it together with others in a forest,

original: ri'am / mtshams kyi bar ram /
analyzed: ri'am / mtshams kyi bar ram /
translated: on a mountain, in a secluded place,

original: chu'am / lcug ma'i tshal dag la mes sreg par byed pa dag 'di ltar me tshim par byas pas lha dag dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'am / lcug ma'i tshal dag la mes sreg par byed pa dag 'di ltar me tshim par byas pas lha dag dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: or in a bamboo grove, and burn it with fire, thinking, ‘The gods will be pleased by this fire offering.

original: de dag dga' ba dang / lha yul du khrid par byed de /
analyzed: de dag dga' ba dang / lha yul du khrid par byed de /
translated: They will be pleased and lead me to the god realms.’

original: bdag lha'i 'jig rten de thob pa dang / me tshim par byas pas bdag der lha'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag lha'i 'jig rten de thob pa dang / me tshim par byas pas bdag der lha'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: “I will obtain the world of the gods and, by satisfying the fire, I will obtain divine joy there.”

original: rmongs pa thos pa ngan pas bslus pa de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba skye bo thams cad sreg pa zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa thos pa ngan pas bslus pa de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba skye bo thams cad sreg pa zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the deluded one, deceived by bad learning, later separates from his body, he will fall into the lower realms, into the Unrelenting Hell, where he will be born in the hell realm called Burning All Beings.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “The following tortures will occur there.🔽The beings in that realm will experience all the tortures of the Reviving Hell and so forth, five times more intense.

original: gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
translated: In addition, the following tortures will occur there.

original: 'di ltar der skyes pa gang dag las kyis sprul pa'i bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / dga' ba'i bsten grogs dang / pha ma dang / de las gzhan pa dga' ba dang 'brel pa de dag der 'tshed pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar der skyes pa gang dag las kyis sprul pa'i bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / dga' ba'i bsten grogs dang / pha ma dang / de las gzhan pa dga' ba dang 'brel pa de dag der 'tshed pa na /
translated: The beings in that realm will be born there as a result of their own karmic actions, and they will see their children, daughters, wives, beloved companions, parents, and other loved ones being boiled there.

original: bu dang / chung ma dang / bsten grogs dang / pha ma'i tshogs de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: bu dang / chung ma dang / bsten grogs dang / pha ma'i tshogs de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees his children, his wife, his friends, his father and mother, and all his relatives.

original: de dag kyang de ltar sems can dmyal bar 'tshed pa mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang de ltar sems can dmyal bar 'tshed pa mthong ste /
translated: And he sees them being boiled in the hells.

original: 'tshed pa de mthong ba dang / yid kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pa tsha ba rtsub pa dag myong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'tshed pa de mthong ba dang / yid kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pa tsha ba rtsub pa dag myong bar byed do //
translated: When he sees them being boiled, he experiences an unbearable mental suffering, painful, sharp, and severe.

original: dga' ba'i tshogs de dag thams cad mthong nas mya ngan gyi me'i rnam pa 'di @359a *//🔽lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshogs de dag thams cad mthong nas mya ngan gyi me'i rnam pa 'di @359a *// lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he sees all those who were his friends, this kind of fire of grief arises in him:

original: gang sems can dmyal ba pa'i me de dag sred pa'i me'i bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba pa'i me de dag sred pa'i me'i bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
translated: “The fire of the hells does not amount to a sixteenth part of the fire of craving.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i me thams cad kyi nang na sred pa'i me thams cad ches shin tu tsha'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i me thams cad kyi nang na sred pa'i me thams cad ches shin tu tsha'o //
translated: Among all the fires of the hells, the fire of craving is the most burning.

original: me rnams kyi nang na'ang 'di ni me yin no //🔽zhags pa rnams kyi nang na 'di zhags pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: me rnams kyi nang na'ang 'di ni me yin no // zhags pa rnams kyi nang na 'di zhags pa mchog yin no //
translated: Among all the fires, this is the fire.🔽Among all the snares, this is the supreme snare.

original: 'ching ba rnams kyi nang na 'ching ba dam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams kyi nang na 'ching ba dam pa yin te /
translated: Among all the bonds, this is the most binding.

original: 'ching ba des so so'i skye bo byis pa thams cad bcings so //
analyzed: 'ching ba des so so'i skye bo byis pa thams cad bcings so //
translated: All ordinary, childish beings are bound by this.

original: gang log pa'i las kyis byas pa'i dga' ba'i tshogs sems can dmyal ba pa dag mthong nas kyang sred pas de bzhin sreg ste /
analyzed: gang log pa'i las kyis byas pa'i dga' ba'i tshogs sems can dmyal ba pa dag mthong nas kyang sred pas de bzhin sreg ste /
translated: “ ‘Those who see the gatherings of beings in hell, created by their own wrong actions, are burned by craving.

original: gang me de dag las byung ba'i sems can dmyal ba pa kha ba lta bur gyur pa de'ang de'i bu dang chung ma'i tshogs dang / pha ma'i tshogs du skad 'don te /
analyzed: gang me de dag las byung ba'i sems can dmyal ba pa kha ba lta bur gyur pa de'ang de'i bu dang chung ma'i tshogs dang / pha ma'i tshogs du skad 'don te /
translated: The beings in hell, who are like snow, are the children and wives of those who are burned by the fire. The parents of those in hell cry out,

original: 'di ltar bdag cag la yongs su bskyab pa gyis snying rje rje skad du du skad 'don kyang de dag yongs su bskyab par ga la nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag la yongs su bskyab pa gyis snying rje rje skad du du skad 'don kyang de dag yongs su bskyab par ga la nus te /
translated: “Please save us!” They cry out in compassion, but how can they be saved?

original: gang sems can dmyal ba pa dbang med pa mes sreg cing 'tshed do //
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba pa dbang med pa mes sreg cing 'tshed do //
translated: The beings in hell are powerless. They are burned and boiled by the fire.

original: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du de yun ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar lus dang / yid kyis mes sreg go /
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du de yun ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar lus dang / yid kyis mes sreg go /
translated: In this way, for a long time, for countless years, they are burned by the fire of body and mind until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, they will escape that hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de lo sum brgyar yi dvags gtor ma za bar skye bar @359b 'gyur /
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de lo sum brgyar yi dvags gtor ma za bar skye bar @359b 'gyur /
translated: but in terms of effects that accord with the relevant causal actions, they will then be born as starving spirits subsisting on offerings for three hundred years.

original: tshe rabs lnga brgyar dung ma lta bu'i nang der de'i bus pa pho mo nya pa dag gis gsod par byed do //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar dung ma lta bu'i nang der de'i bus pa pho mo nya pa dag gis gsod par byed do //
translated: For five hundred lives they will be born as fish in the womb of a conch, and there they will be killed by fishermen.

original: gal te gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: gal te gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de dbul zhing tshe thung ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / bu dang / chung ma dang bral zhing gang dag tu bran g-yog tu 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dbul zhing tshe thung ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / bu dang / chung ma dang bral zhing gang dag tu bran g-yog tu 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: they will be poor, short-lived, and have incomplete faculties. They will be separated from their children and spouse, and they will be servants.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Heat, he will apply insight derived from hearing and thus perceive a neighboring realm known as the Hell of the Great Darkness of the Black Line.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba sar 'bying mtha' yas zhes bya ba de ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba sar 'bying mtha' yas zhes bya ba de ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: Through his knowledge derived from hearing, he will see a hell called Endless Quagmire.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur te /🔽mdor na lus kyi chad pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur te / mdor na lus kyi chad pa'am /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus see that such a birth is caused by resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, and lying.

original: ngag gi chad pa'i las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gi chad pa'i las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, such a birth is caused by resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of body and speech, as well as the preparations for such acts and their conclusions.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba der 'bying mtha' yas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba der 'bying mtha' yas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one later separates from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as Endless Quagmire.

original: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsdus pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsdus pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ngo //
translated: The suffering of the hell beings in the Reviving Hell and so on is five times greater than that.

original: log par lta bar gyur pa ni thos pa ngan pa gang gis @360a *//
analyzed: log par lta bar gyur pa ni thos pa ngan pa gang gis @360a *//
translated: Those who have the view of annihilation are deceived by bad teachings.

original: srin bu phre'u dang / grog sbur dang / sbrul dang / sbrul shin tu gdug pa dang / ri dvags dang / bya rnams me'i nang du bcug na me de dag ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srin bu phre'u dang / grog sbur dang / sbrul dang / sbrul shin tu gdug pa dang / ri dvags dang / bya rnams me'i nang du bcug na me de dag ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They say, “If you throw insects, ants, snakes, poisonous snakes, deer, and birds into the fire, that fire will be pleased.

original: dga' nas kyang 'jig rten mtha' yas pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: dga' nas kyang 'jig rten mtha' yas pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: When pleased, it will give to infinite worlds.

original: mer bsregs pa de dag gis kyang drag po'i 'jig rten mi bzad par byed do //
analyzed: mer bsregs pa de dag gis kyang drag po'i 'jig rten mi bzad par byed do //
translated: Those who are burned in the fire will create an unbearable world of wrath.

original: gang mer bcug pa de dag de'i chos chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrags shing /
analyzed: gang mer bcug pa de dag de'i chos chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrags shing /
translated: Those who are thrown into the fire will attain the great Dharma.”

original: de ltar 'dzin du 'jug pa ni chos log pas rnam par bslus pa log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin du 'jug pa ni chos log pas rnam par bslus pa log par lta ba yin te /
translated: Those who hold such views are deceived by false teachings and have the view of annihilation.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba sar 'bying mtha' yas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba sar 'bying mtha' yas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as Boundless Descent into the Ground.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “The beings in that realm will experience the following tortures.

original: mdag ma'i ri rgyar dpag tshad lnga yod pa kun nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i mes rab tu 'bar ba de la sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis gteg cing 'dor bar byed de /
analyzed: mdag ma'i ri rgyar dpag tshad lnga yod pa kun nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i mes rab tu 'bar ba de la sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis gteg cing 'dor bar byed de /
translated: The henchmen of the Lord of Death will throw the hell beings into a mountain of embers that measures five leagues across and is ablaze with the fire of the hells.

original: rkang pa dang / rked pa dang / 'doms dang / rgyab dang / dpung pa dang / mgrin pa dang / lag pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / mgo dang / klad pa'i bar bsregs nas de nas kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽sreg pa na ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du /
analyzed: rkang pa dang / rked pa dang / 'doms dang / rgyab dang / dpung pa dang / mgrin pa dang / lag pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / mgo dang / klad pa'i bar bsregs nas de nas kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te / sreg pa na ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du /
translated: The hell beings will be burned from the feet up, from the waist up, from the back forward, from the shoulders up, from the neck up, from the hands up, from the eyes up, from the ears up, from the head up, and from the brain up, and then they will emerge again.

original: dus du ma yun ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sreg go /
analyzed: dus du ma yun ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sreg go /
translated: Thus, they will be burned for many years, for many hundreds of years, for many thousands of years, for many hundreds of thousands of years, until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.🔽“The beings in that realm will experience such burning for many years, for many hundreds of years, for many thousands of years, for many hundreds of thousands of years, until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur @360b te; thar nas kyang log par lta ba mi bzad pas las de dang rgyu mthun par tshe rabs lnga brgyar yi dvags mi gtsang ba za ba lus thams cad rab tu 'bar ba mtshan mo rgyu ba🔽na skye bo kun gyis mthong ba dang / las ngan pa byas pa dbang du gyur par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur @360b te; thar nas kyang log par lta ba mi bzad pas las de dang rgyu mthun par tshe rabs lnga brgyar yi dvags mi gtsang ba za ba lus thams cad rab tu 'bar ba mtshan mo rgyu ba na skye bo kun gyis mthong ba dang / las ngan pa byas pa dbang du gyur par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, when they escape from that hell, they will, as an effect that accords with their causal actions, be born five hundred times as starving spirits that subsist on filth, their bodies completely ablaze, wandering at night🔽and seen by everyone.🔽When they escape from that realm of starving spirits, they will, as an effect that accords with their causal actions, be born as animals, their bodies completely covered with insects that have flaming mouths, and they will be seen by everyone day and night.

original: yi dvags kyi ris de las thar nas kyang dud 'gro lus thams cad la srin bu me lce rab tu 'bar ba 'byung zhing nyin mtshan du skye bo kun gyi mngon sum du 'gyur ba dang / khong pa'i nang du me zhugs pas sreg cing nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gi 'od zer zil gyis non par 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
analyzed: yi dvags kyi ris de las thar nas kyang dud 'gro lus thams cad la srin bu me lce rab tu 'bar ba 'byung zhing nyin mtshan du skye bo kun gyi mngon sum du 'gyur ba dang / khong pa'i nang du me zhugs pas sreg cing nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gi 'od zer zil gyis non par 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
translated: They will be burned by fire inside their bodies, and the light of the sun will be blocked.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī of the Application of Mindfulness to the Sacred Dharma

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /

original: de mthar 'dzin pa lta ba gnyis kyi rgyu ngan pa; lta ba ngan pa'i mtha' gzhan dag 'dzin du 'jug cing yang dag par dga' bar byed du 'jug la yang dag par rab tu 'jog 'khor la chos ma yin pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing rab tu 'jog
analyzed: de mthar 'dzin pa lta ba gnyis kyi rgyu ngan pa; lta ba ngan pa'i mtha' gzhan dag 'dzin du 'jug cing yang dag par dga' bar byed du 'jug la yang dag par rab tu 'jog 'khor la chos ma yin pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing rab tu 'jog
translated: Such people may then hold the view of the two extremes, and they may cause others to adopt and delight in such a view. They may also establish their retinue in the teachings of non-Dharma by means of non-Dharma.

original: par byed pa de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba nags tshal gyi me mun ltar 'khrigs par skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar gang gi tshe gshin rje'i mi'i gnod pa dag las gal te thar nas kyang phyis de'i las kyis
analyzed: par byed pa de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba nags tshal gyi me mun ltar 'khrigs par skye bar 'gyur ro // der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa de dag thams cad lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar gang gi tshe gshin rje'i mi'i gnod pa dag las gal te thar nas kyang phyis de'i las kyis
translated: When they separate from their bodies, they fall into the lower realms, into the hell known as Forest Fire-Like Darkness.

original: byas pa'i mun pa mun nag gi tshogs kyi rlung ldang ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i mun pa mun nag gi tshogs kyi rlung ldang ste /
translated: “The beings in that realm experience combined forms of all the tortures found in the Reviving Hell and so forth, and they also experience the following particular tortures. When they escape the tortures of the Lord of Death’s henchmen, they will later be caught by the wind of darkness created by their own karmic actions.

original: des sems can dmyal ba pa de dag dmigs pa med pa nam mkha' la ji ltar de'i lus kyang mi mngon pa de ltar skor ro //
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba pa de dag dmigs pa med pa nam mkha' la ji ltar de'i lus kyang mi mngon pa de ltar skor ro //
translated: This wind will blow the hell beings into the sky, where they are invisible.

original: yongs su bskor ba dang rlung gzhan spu gri lta bur ldang ste /
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba dang rlung gzhan spu gri lta bur ldang ste /
translated: They will be blown around in the sky until another wind, like a razor, rises up.

original: des lus de chang pa nas bye ma 'thor ba ltar phyogs bcur 'thor ro //
analyzed: des lus de chang pa nas bye ma 'thor ba ltar phyogs bcur 'thor ro //
translated: This wind will scatter their bodies in the ten directions, like grains of sand.

original: de nas yang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then they will be born again,

original: yang 'thor ro //
analyzed: yang 'thor ro //
translated: and again they will be scattered.

original: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yun shin tu ring ba lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sdug bsngal drag cing tshal rtsub ba dag myong bar 'gyur @367a *//
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yun shin tu ring ba lo bgrang gis mi lang bar sdug bsngal drag cing tshal rtsub ba dag myong bar 'gyur @367a *//
translated: In this way, for a very long time, for countless years, they will experience intense and violent suffering until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: ro; ;de phyis de las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ro; ;de phyis de las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: When they escape from that realm,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs bzhi brgyar yi dvags skyugs pa za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de las thar nas kyang gang dud 'gro lhag ma za ba bkres pa dang / skom pas yongs su gdungs pa'i lus su 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs bzhi brgyar yi dvags skyugs pa za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // de las thar nas kyang gang dud 'gro lhag ma za ba bkres pa dang / skom pas yongs su gdungs pa'i lus su 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: in accordance with the causal actions they will, in four hundred lives, be born among the vomit-eating ghosts.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: When they escape from that realm, they will take birth as animals that eat the leftovers of others, and they will have bodies that are tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Heat, he will apply insight derived from hearing.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba bud pa rdo rje lta bus gnod pa'i go cha zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa de mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba bud pa rdo rje lta bus gnod pa'i go cha zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa de mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang /
translated: Through the knowledge derived from hearing he saw that the vajra-like armor of the hell of the vajra-like armor of the hell of the burning hell is like this:🔽“What karma causes beings to be born there?”

original: rdzun smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzun smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the knowledge derived from hearing he examined this and saw that it is due to resorting to, becoming habituated with, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol.🔽“What is the false view?”

original: log par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma yod cing rgyu yod pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma yod cing rgyu yod pa'o //
translated: “It is the view that this cyclic existence has a beginning and a cause.

original: gang 'di dag thams cad kyi rgyu rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang 'di dag thams cad kyi rgyu rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyis te /
translated: “What is the cause of all of this? It is the two, the permanent and the impermanent.

original: des bskyed do zhes rdzun de rgyu ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i mthas bslad pa de chos ma yin pa chos kyi tshul du ston cing pha rol rab tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: des bskyed do zhes rdzun de rgyu ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i mthas bslad pa de chos ma yin pa chos kyi tshul du ston cing pha rol rab tu 'jog par byed /
translated: “This is produced by that” is a false cause, and the one who is corrupted by the extreme of bad views teaches what is not the Dharma as if it were the Dharma and establishes others in that.

original: yang dag pa'i lam las bskol bar byed cing chos las phyir @367b zlog par byed la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam las bskol bar byed cing chos las phyir @367b zlog par byed la /
translated: He causes them to be carried away from the true path and to turn away from the Dharma.

original: log par lta ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed kyang de de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed kyang de de ltar ma yin te /
translated: He causes them to adopt wrong views, but that is not the case.

original: rgyur gyur pa rtag pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa rtag pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no permanent cause.

original: rtag pa ni dus dang bral ba /
analyzed: rtag pa ni dus dang bral ba /
translated: The permanent is free from time,

original: 'gyur ba med pa; de skyed pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa; de skyed pa ma yin pa /
translated: unchanging, and not a producer.

original: nam mkha' lta bu yin na de'ang gzhan du rtog ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu yin na de'ang gzhan du rtog ste /
translated: It is like space, but it is imagined to be something else.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba bung ba rdo rje lta bus gnod pa'i ge char skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba bung ba rdo rje lta bus gnod pa'i ge char skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they separate from their bodies, they fall into the lower realms, into the hells, and are born in the hell where one is struck by vajra-like bees.

original: de lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pas nyen pas nyams pa /
analyzed: de lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pas nyen pas nyams pa /
translated: They are harmed by the punishments of body, speech, and mind, and are destroyed.

original: skyes bu ngan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu ngan pa /
translated: They are evil people.

original: log par lta ba /
analyzed: log par lta ba /
translated: They have wrong views.

original: yang dag par smra ba phyir 'gog pa; yang dag par ma yin pa smra ba la rab tu 'jog pa /
analyzed: yang dag par smra ba phyir 'gog pa; yang dag par ma yin pa smra ba la rab tu 'jog pa /
translated: They refute those who speak correctly and establish those who speak incorrectly.

original: rmongs pas lam ngan par zhugs pa /
analyzed: rmongs pas lam ngan par zhugs pa /
translated: They are confused and follow bad paths.

original: shes rab kyi nga rgyal can rang gis yongs su brtags pa smra ba ni gnod pa dag dang phrad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi nga rgyal can rang gis yongs su brtags pa smra ba ni gnod pa dag dang phrad de /
translated: They are arrogant about their wisdom and speak what they have imagined. They will encounter harm.

original: gang sems can dmyal pa yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa dag lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du byung ba /
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal pa yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa dag lnga 'gyur du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du byung ba /
translated: They will experience five times the harm that is experienced in the Reviving Hell and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In particular,

original: gshin rje'i mi phra skam phra mo thogs pas sha ba sbu tsam du btogs btogs nas de nyid zar 'jug go /🔽bung ba'i mchu rdo rje can lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi phra skam phra mo thogs pas sha ba sbu tsam du btogs btogs nas de nyid zar 'jug go / bung ba'i mchu rdo rje can lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: the henchmen of the Lord of Death will take up fine needles and cut the flesh of these hell beings into pieces the size of sesame seeds, which they will then force them to eat.🔽They will also experience the following:

original: gang de'i lus la lan tshva ltar drag par byed de /
analyzed: gang de'i lus la lan tshva ltar drag par byed de /
translated: Iron bees with vajra-like beaks will appear and pierce their bodies, which will then become as salty as if they had been sprinkled with salt.

original: de la khrag dron po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la khrag dron po 'byung ngo //
translated: Their bodies will then be covered with hot blood.

original: de gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis de nyid zar 'jug ste /
analyzed: de gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis de nyid zar 'jug ste /
translated: The henchmen of the Lord of Death will force them to eat their own flesh.

original: zas des de'i srog 'tsho bar byas so //
analyzed: zas des de'i srog 'tsho bar byas so //
translated: The food sustains his life.

original: nyes bar byas pa'i las kyis bslus pa de'ang bkres pa dang / skom pas lus dang / @368a *//
analyzed: nyes bar byas pa'i las kyis bslus pa de'ang bkres pa dang / skom pas lus dang / @368a *//
translated: Deceived by his bad actions, he is tormented by hunger and thirst,

original: snying bcu 'gyur du gdungs so //
analyzed: snying bcu 'gyur du gdungs so //
translated: and his body and heart are torn to pieces.

original: de nas yang las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gi sha dang / khrag de nyid 'byung bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gi sha dang / khrag de nyid 'byung bar byed de /
translated: Then, in accordance with his causal actions, his own flesh and blood appear,

original: rang gi las kyis 'chi ba'i dus mi byed do;/
analyzed: rang gi las kyis 'chi ba'i dus mi byed do;/
translated: but because of his own actions, he does not die.

original: de nas yang rang gi sha dang / khrag de nyid 'byung bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang rang gi sha dang / khrag de nyid 'byung bar byed de /
translated: Then, his own flesh and blood appear,

original: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du las kyis bslus pa de yun shin tu ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar gnod pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du las kyis bslus pa de yun shin tu ring po lo bgrang gis mi lang bar gnod pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and he experiences pain for a very long time, for hundreds of thousands of years, until finally his bad actions have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When he finally escapes from that hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs bzhi brgyar yi dvags lhag ma za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs bzhi brgyar yi dvags lhag ma za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they escape that hell, the result in accordance with their causal actions will be that they will be born four hundred times as a hungry ghost that eats leftovers.

original: tshe rabs lnga brgyar dud 'gro tsi lin da dang / ba lang gi nags tshal la sogs par bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa'i lus su skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar dud 'gro tsi lin da dang / ba lang gi nags tshal la sogs par bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa'i lus su skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: For five hundred lives they will be born with a body that is tormented by hunger and thirst as an animal in the Cīna and Goṣīrṣa forests.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na; des bcu bdun pa ni gcig kyang ma mthong la /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na; des bcu bdun pa ni gcig kyang ma mthong la /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Heat, he will not see a seventeenth region.

original: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor 'di'i mtha' ni 'di yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i 'khor 'di'i mtha' ni 'di yin /
translated: ‘This is the end of the regions that surround the great Hell of Heat.

original: gnas pa ni 'di yin /
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'di yin /
translated: This is where they stay.

original: log par lta ba pa ngan par byas pa'i las byas pa rnams kyi gnas ni 'di yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba pa ngan par byas pa'i las byas pa rnams kyi gnas ni 'di yin no snyam ste /
translated: This is where those who have engaged in evil and wrong views stay.’

original: des sems can dmyal ba chen po bcu drug pa la brtags nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nang gi chos la @368b chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de rab tu dga' ba dang / sa bla ba'i gnod sbyin dag gis de mthong nas /
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba chen po bcu drug pa la brtags nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nang gi chos la @368b chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de rab tu dga' ba dang / sa bla ba'i gnod sbyin dag gis de mthong nas /
translated: “When the spiritual practitioner who carefully observes inner phenomena as they really are examines the sixteen great hells, he will become joyful and the terrestrial yakṣas will see this and inform the celestial yakṣas.

original: kye ae ma /
analyzed: kye ae ma /
translated: Kye ema!🔽🔽

original: dge slong 'di ni brtson pa mnyams pa sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs shing 'khor ba'i dus rnam par gcod par byed pa de'ang shes nas dga' ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni brtson pa mnyams pa sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs shing 'khor ba'i dus rnam par gcod par byed pa de'ang shes nas dga' ste /
translated: This monk has entered the eleventh ground with undiminished diligence and he has also understood how to cut through the time of cyclic existence.’

original: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag la snga ma bzhin mngon par bsnyad nas /🔽'od chung gi lha'i bar dag la 'di ltar rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ces bya ba snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag la snga ma bzhin mngon par bsnyad nas / 'od chung gi lha'i bar dag la 'di ltar rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ces bya ba snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They will then inform the celestial yakṣas of the atmosphere in the same way as before.

original: sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa /
translated: In this way, they will inform the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, and the Heaven of Lesser Light, saying, ‘Noble son, so-and-so has entered the eleventh ground.

original: bdud kyi gzhi dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi gzhi dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod pa /
translated: He does not wish to remain in the domain of the māras.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar mi 'dod pa /
translated: They do not wish to play with the afflictions of desire.

original: yul la gnas pa'i 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyi gzhi mtha' yas pa mi 'dod pa'i bar dag bsnyad do //
analyzed: yul la gnas pa'i 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyi gzhi mtha' yas pa mi 'dod pa'i bar dag bsnyad do //
translated: They do not wish for the endless basis of suffering of beings who remain in the world of objects.

original: de nas yang dge slong des sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags nas sems can dmyal ba gzhan la'ang brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong des sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags nas sems can dmyal ba gzhan la'ang brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk will examine the surrounding hells of Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghata, Raurava, Mahāraurava, and Tapana. After examining these hells, he will examine the other hells.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba rab tu tsha ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba rab tu tsha ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then perceive a hell known as Extremely Hot.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun @369a *//
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun @369a *//
translated: Inquiring into what karmic ripening causes beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and so see that such a birth is caused by resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, and lying.

original: smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: and who have relied on, become habituated to, and increased wrong views.

original: dge slong ma gzhon nu sdom pa la gnas pa /🔽tshul khrims ma nyams pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma gzhon nu sdom pa la gnas pa / tshul khrims ma nyams pa /
translated: “Young bhikṣuṇīs who are in the restraint,🔽who have unimpaired conduct,

original: brkam pa med par spyod pa /
analyzed: brkam pa med par spyod pa /
translated: who are not greedy,

original: 'dod pa med pa'i brtul zhugs nyams par byas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las 'khrul par byas la de sangs rgyas la mi dad par byas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa'i brtul zhugs nyams par byas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las 'khrul par byas la de sangs rgyas la mi dad par byas te /
translated: who have unimpaired celibacy, and who have strayed from the teachings of the Tathāgata, will have no faith in the Buddha.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin na de'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnam pa 'di lta bus ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin na de'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnam pa 'di lta bus ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: They will say, ‘The Buddha is not omniscient. What is the point of his bhikṣuṇī saṅgha being like this?

original: de dag thams cad ni rdzun yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni rdzun yin te /
translated: All of them are false.

original: bstan pa de ni ngan pa yin zhing de ni dman pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa de ni ngan pa yin zhing de ni dman pa yin te /
translated: This teaching is bad and inferior.

original: de la byin pas chos su mi 'gyur zhing de la byin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la byin pas chos su mi 'gyur zhing de la byin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Giving to them does not become a Dharma. Giving to them does not bring the attainment of nirvāṇa.’

original: dge 'dun 'di ni dmangs yin no zhes dge slong ma gzhon nu'i brtul zhugs las bskyod cing chos ma yin pa med do zhes de de ltar sems su bcug nas dge slong ma gzhon nu de brtul zhugs las skyod par byed /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'di ni dmangs yin no zhes dge slong ma gzhon nu'i brtul zhugs las bskyod cing chos ma yin pa med do zhes de de ltar sems su bcug nas dge slong ma gzhon nu de brtul zhugs las skyod par byed /
translated: He will say, ‘The Saṅgha is the people,’ and thus cause the young nuns to abandon their discipline.

original: chos ma yin pa med do zhes tshul khrims 'khrul pa dang lta ba 'khrul par byed na /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa med do zhes tshul khrims 'khrul pa dang lta ba 'khrul par byed na /

analyzed: 'dod chags chung bas zin pa gang //

original: de bye ma rdo rje'i gzegs ma lta bur zur gsum yod cing so rno ba de dag gis ji ltar de'i rus pa lhag ma'ang med pa de ltar 'thag go /
analyzed: de bye ma rdo rje'i gzegs ma lta bur zur gsum yod cing so rno ba de dag gis ji ltar de'i rus pa lhag ma'ang med pa de ltar 'thag go /
translated: is ground up by those sand grains that are like vajra shards with three sharp edges, until not even the bones remain.

original: de nas yang 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas yang 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
translated: Then, one comes back to life again,

original: de nas yang 'thag ste 'chi zhing skye'o //
analyzed: de nas yang 'thag ste 'chi zhing skye'o //

analyzed: de kun nas dga' ba med cing bye ma rab tu 'bar ba'i nang du nub ste /

analyzed: sreg cing 'tshed pa dang skad 'byin cing yongs smre sngags 'don te /
translated: They are burned, boiled, and scream.

analyzed: de las kyis bsgribs pa sdug bsngal de las bdag nyid thar bar mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to free themselves from that suffering, which is obscured by karma.

original: de yun ring mo zhig 'das la gal te las zad nas sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yun ring mo zhig 'das la gal te las zad nas sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: After a very long time, if they should happen to finish their karmic actions and escape that hell,

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de tshe rabs stong phrag du mar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de tshe rabs stong phrag du mar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par 'gyur /
translated: in accordance with their causal actions, they will be tormented by hunger and thirst for many thousands of lives as a hungry ghost or an animal.

original: dud 'gro gcig la gcig za bar srog lan stong 'chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dud 'gro gcig la gcig za bar srog lan stong 'chad par 'gyur /
translated: They will be an animal that eats other animals, and will lose its life a thousand times.

original: de las thar nas kyang gal te gnya' shing gi bu @389b gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na de tshe rabs lnga brgyar dbul zhing nad bu can dang / smyo ba dang / ngag yid mi ches pa dang /
analyzed: de las thar nas kyang gal te gnya' shing gi bu @389b gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na de tshe rabs lnga brgyar dbul zhing nad bu can dang / smyo ba dang / ngag yid mi ches pa dang /
translated: If they should escape that and are born with the general lot in life of a human, in accordance with their causal actions, they will be poor and sickly for five hundred lives, insane, and their words and thoughts will be untrustworthy.

original: gzhan gyis bkol ba dang / za mar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkol ba dang / za mar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will see others being exploited and enslaved.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the regions that surround the great Reviving Hell.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba nang na me mdag yod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba nang na me mdag yod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see a neighboring realm of the Reviving Hell known as Embers.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, lie, and hold wrong views.

original: gang gis dge bsnyen ma bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yod pa stobs kyis mnan nas mi tshangs par spyad pas bslab pa dral cing 'di snyam du srung ma mo bslab pa'i gzhi las 'das pa chos ma yin pa gang yang med do snyam du blo skye zhing /
analyzed: gang gis dge bsnyen ma bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yod pa stobs kyis mnan nas mi tshangs par spyad pas bslab pa dral cing 'di snyam du srung ma mo bslab pa'i gzhi las 'das pa chos ma yin pa gang yang med do snyam du blo skye zhing /
translated: “When an upāsaka, through the power of his training, has violated the five precepts and has had impure conduct, he may think, ‘There is nothing that is not Dharma, and there is no transgression of the precepts that I have not guarded.’

original: las kyi 'bras bu la yid mi ches na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba nang na me mdag yod bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la yid mi ches na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba nang na me mdag yod bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If he does not believe in the effects of karmic actions, when he later separates from his body, he will fall into the lower realms, into the hell of Embers in the Stomach.

original: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad sems @390a *//
analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad sems @390a *//
translated: “The beings in that realm experience the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell, and so forth.

original: can dmyal ba 'dir 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de kun nas me mdag gi ri lnga la /
analyzed: can dmyal ba 'dir 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de kun nas me mdag gi ri lnga la /
translated: On top of that, they experience the following particular tortures. The beings in that hell are surrounded by five mountains of burning embers.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The following are the five:

original: kun sreg dang; gting zab dang / mun nag thibs dang / me mdag tsha ba lta bu dang / las mngon sum pa rnams kyi yongs su bskor ba der sems can dmyal ba de kun nas dpag tshad stong yod la /
analyzed: kun sreg dang; gting zab dang / mun nag thibs dang / me mdag tsha ba lta bu dang / las mngon sum pa rnams kyi yongs su bskor ba der sems can dmyal ba de kun nas dpag tshad stong yod la /
translated: The hell beings are surrounded by the following: the Burning, the Deep Abyss, the Thick Darkness, the Hot Embers, and the Manifest Karma.

original: ri de dag kyang kun nas ri khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dag dang ha cang mi ring ba na yod de /
analyzed: ri de dag kyang kun nas ri khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dag dang ha cang mi ring ba na yod de /
translated: The mountain is a thousand leagues high, and the mountains are not far from the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains.

original: der sems can dmyal ba pa des ri de dag me tog autpa las gang ba lta bu dang / shing ljon pa dang / nags tshal dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa lta bur mthong ste /
analyzed: der sems can dmyal ba pa des ri de dag me tog autpa las gang ba lta bu dang / shing ljon pa dang / nags tshal dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa lta bur mthong ste /
translated: The hell beings see the mountains as if they were filled with blue lotuses, and as if they were perfect with trees, forests, and ponds.

original: de dag bde ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir de gang gi tshe brgyugs pa dang / de'i tshe las kyi rlung me lta bu langs pas bdas so //
analyzed: de dag bde ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir de gang gi tshe brgyugs pa dang / de'i tshe las kyi rlung me lta bu langs pas bdas so //
translated: In order to experience that pleasure, when they run there, a karma-born wind blows, like fire.

original: me mdag de dag kyang rlung des bus so //
analyzed: me mdag de dag kyang rlung des bus so //
translated: That wind blows on the hot embers.

original: bus pa des sems can dmyal ba pa de kun nas yongs su bkres so //
analyzed: bus pa des sems can dmyal ba pa de kun nas yongs su bkres so //
translated: The wind blows on the hell beings, burning them all over.

original: lus thams bsregs pa de'ang ri de dag gi gzugs sngon por mthong ste /🔽tsha bas gdungs pa ma gon 'dod pa /
analyzed: lus thams bsregs pa de'ang ri de dag gi gzugs sngon por mthong ste / tsha bas gdungs pa ma gon 'dod pa /
translated: The bodies of those beings are burned by the fire, and they see the mountains as blue.

original: skyabs 'dod pa /
analyzed: skyabs 'dod pa /
translated: They are tormented by heat and seek protection.

original: dpung gnyen 'dod pa de'ang rgyug go /
analyzed: dpung gnyen 'dod pa de'ang rgyug go /
translated: They seek refuge and seek a friend.🔽They run toward the mountains.🔽When they reach the foot of the mountains, they are unable to see the mountains, because the mountains are covered with iron arrows that are shot as soon as they approach.

original: de gang gi tshe ri de'i drung du phyin pa dang / de 'di ltar kun nas byi brun la lcags kyi mda' 'phen pa 'phangs pa tsam gyis 'gro ba mi mngon pa de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de me mdag gi @390b nang du 'gro ba'i 'gros kyang gar song gtol med par mi mngon no //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe ri de'i drung du phyin pa dang / de 'di ltar kun nas byi brun la lcags kyi mda' 'phen pa 'phangs pa tsam gyis 'gro ba mi mngon pa de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de me mdag gi @390b nang du 'gro ba'i 'gros kyang gar song gtol med par mi mngon no //
translated: In the same way, the beings in hell are unable to see the path they have taken as they enter the fire.

original: de der song ma thag tu 'di ltar sreg cing 'tshed la skol ba na mun pa mun nag gi nang du song nas dbang po thams cad 'gags shing sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur te /
analyzed: de der song ma thag tu 'di ltar sreg cing 'tshed la skol ba na mun pa mun nag gi nang du song nas dbang po thams cad 'gags shing sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur te /
translated: As soon as they enter there, they are burned, boiled, and scorched. They enter the darkness and all their faculties cease to function. They become the basis of all suffering.

original: nyes pa byas pa'i 'bras bu thams cad mngon sum du byung la /
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa'i 'bras bu thams cad mngon sum du byung la /
translated: The results of their misdeeds manifest directly.

original: des gang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa de dag de'i las kyi shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu la nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: des gang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa de dag de'i las kyi shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu la nye bar spyod do //
translated: Whatever non-virtuous actions he has done and accumulated, he experiences the results that come from the force of those actions.

original: de ltar de me mdag gi mun pa'i nang na dpung gnyen med cing grogs med pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pas nyam thag par gyur pa /
analyzed: de ltar de me mdag gi mun pa'i nang na dpung gnyen med cing grogs med pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pas nyam thag par gyur pa /
translated: Thus, in the darkness of the burning embers, he is without a protector, without a companion, and tormented by unbearable suffering.

original: yun ring du rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par zhugs pa yun ring du 'tshed do //
analyzed: yun ring du rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par zhugs pa yun ring du 'tshed do //
translated: For a long time, he experiences the results of his own actions, and is cooked for a long time.

original: de gal te yang las kyi rlung de dag nyid kyis me mdag de dag gi nang nas 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: de gal te yang las kyi rlung de dag nyid kyis me mdag de dag gi nang nas 'byin par byed de /
translated: If the winds of karma cause him to emerge from the burning embers,

original: lus thams cad bskol cing sdug bsngal thams cad kyis nyam thag pa de rkang pa gar bab bab tu 'dor ro //
analyzed: lus thams cad bskol cing sdug bsngal thams cad kyis nyam thag pa de rkang pa gar bab bab tu 'dor ro //
translated: he will fall down wherever his body is cooked, tormented by all kinds of suffering.

original: de nas yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, he will emerge again,

original: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis bzung ngo //
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis bzung ngo //
translated: and the henchmen of the Lord of Death will seize him.

analyzed: gzung nas kyang de'i rkub sog le rab tu 'bar bas gcod do //

original: bcang cing gtubs nas yang shin tu gzhon sha can du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcang cing gtubs nas yang shin tu gzhon sha can du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after being cut up and chopped, they are born again, extremely tender.

original: de ltar lo 'bum phrag du mar de sog le'i sdug bsngal myong zhing de 'di skad du rnam par sgra 'byin par byed do //🔽bdag gis las dag byas pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar lo 'bum phrag du mar de sog le'i sdug bsngal myong zhing de 'di skad du rnam par sgra 'byin par byed do // bdag gis las dag byas pa yi //
translated: In this way, for many hundreds of thousands of years, they experience the suffering of the saw, and they cry out in this way:🔽“The fruits of the actions I have done

analyzed: 'bras bu de dge bdag nyid yin // 'dod chags @391a *//
translated: are mine, and mine alone.

original: dgra yid gdungs pa ni //
analyzed: dgra yid gdungs pa ni //
translated: The enemy of desire, burning the mind,

original: phyis nas sems can dmyal bar 'ongs //
analyzed: phyis nas sems can dmyal bar 'ongs //
translated: will later come to the hell beings.

original: 'dod chags gdungs pa'i las can gyi //
analyzed: 'dod chags gdungs pa'i las can gyi //
translated: Those who are full of the actions of burning desire,

original: bag med sa na mi gtsang ba'i //
analyzed: bag med sa na mi gtsang ba'i //
translated: on the ground of carelessness,

original: zhags pa de yis bcings pa yis //
analyzed: zhags pa de yis bcings pa yis //
translated: are bound by that impure noose,

analyzed: bdag ni gnas 'di dag tu 'ongs // sngon chad dag ni 'dod chags kyi //
translated: and I have come to this place.🔽Previously, I did not think

analyzed: 'bras bu tsha snyam mi byed de //
translated: that the fruit of desire was hot.

original: mi shes pa yis bdag bslus pas //
analyzed: mi shes pa yis bdag bslus pas //
translated: Because I was deceived by ignorance,

original: 'dir ni bdag gis byas la spyod //🔽brtse med shin tu drag pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag gis byas la spyod // brtse med shin tu drag pa yi //
translated: here I experience what I have done.🔽I have fallen under the power

original: sdig pa dag gi dbang du song //
analyzed: sdig pa dag gi dbang du song //
translated: of cruel, pitiless evil.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho mtha' yas dag /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho mtha' yas dag /
translated: The ocean of suffering is endless.

original: 'di las bdag ni ji ltar thar //
analyzed: 'di las bdag ni ji ltar thar //
translated: How can I escape from this?

original: sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal las //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal las //
translated: From suffering to suffering,

original: 'di yis bdag ni yongs su 'tshed //
analyzed: 'di yis bdag ni yongs su 'tshed //

original: bdag ni sems can dmyal bar zad //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can dmyal bar zad //
translated: I am in the hell of sentient beings.

original: bde ba 'thob pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba 'thob pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see any happiness.

original: de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de nang na me mdag yod pa'i sems can dmyal bar shin tu sdug bsngal bas nyam thag cing du skad 'don te /
analyzed: de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa de nang na me mdag yod pa'i sems can dmyal bar shin tu sdug bsngal bas nyam thag cing du skad 'don te /
translated: In this way, the hell being, in the midst of the burning embers, is tormented by extreme suffering and cries out in distress.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The hell being will continue to experience suffering until finally his negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal pa de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal pa de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, he will escape from that hell.

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs brgya phrag du mar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs brgya phrag du mar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, due to the corresponding effects of his actions, he will be born hundreds of times as a hungry ghost or an animal.

original: yi dvags rnams su bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs ba'i lus can dag gcig la gcig lta ba @391b kho nar zad do //
analyzed: yi dvags rnams su bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs ba'i lus can dag gcig la gcig lta ba @391b kho nar zad do //
translated: In the realm of starving spirits, they are tormented by hunger and thirst, and their bodies are reduced to nothing but skin, bones, and sinews.

original: dud 'gro rnams su gcig la gcig za ba lus lan brgyar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams su gcig la gcig za ba lus lan brgyar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the animal realm, they are eaten by one another and their bodies are killed hundreds of times.

original: de de las thar nas gal te gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na de'i las kyi mthus rtag tu rims kyis 'degs shing dbul ba dang / nad bu can dang / yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should escape and be born with the general lot in life of a human, the force of that karma will cause them to be constantly afflicted by disease, to be poor, and to have incomplete limbs.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions will examine the regions that surround the great Reviving Hell.

original: sems can dmyal ba aa la la zer zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba aa la la zer zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will perceive a neighboring realm of the Reviving Hell known as Alas.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: What karma causes sentient beings to be born there?🔽

original: des brtags na /
analyzed: des brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply insight derived from hearing:

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //🔽des 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi gcig gam; gnyis sam /🔽gsum mam / bzhi'am /
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro // des 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi gcig gam; gnyis sam / gsum mam / bzhi'am /
translated: ‘If one kills, takes what was not given, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, engages in lying, and holds wrong views, and if one repeatedly engages in and increases these acts, one will be born in the hell of Laughter.🔽“ ‘If one violates one or two or three or four or five of the precepts,

original: lnga las gzhan pa blangs pa dang / bu sring dam /🔽bu sring dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: lnga las gzhan pa blangs pa dang / bu sring dam / bu sring dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: or if one violates the precepts of a son or a daughter,🔽or if one violates the precepts of a friend’s wife,🔽or if one violates the precepts of a wife who is not suitable,

analyzed: grogs kyi chung ma 'os pa ma yin pa dag la des 'di ltar brda byas nas slu bar byed na /
translated: and if one then deceives others by making signs,

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba aa la la zer bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, upon separating from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell of Laughter.

original: der skyes nas kyang gang sems can dmyal ba @392a *//
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang gang sems can dmyal ba @392a *//
translated: “ ‘The beings in that realm experience the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell, and so forth, intensified a hundredfold.

original: yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
translated: In addition to the harms of the Reviving Hell and so forth, there are the following special features.

original: 'di ltar rlung shin tu drag cing shin tu rtsub la shin tu mi zad pa shugs kyis mgyogs pa dang ldan pa ldang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung shin tu drag cing shin tu rtsub la shin tu mi zad pa shugs kyis mgyogs pa dang ldan pa ldang la /
translated: Very strong, very rough, and very violent winds arise, with the speed of a powerful current.

original: gang gis sems can dmyal ba de dag gi lus so sor khyer bar byed de /🔽ji ltar rlung chen po shin tu mi bzad cing rtsub pas ras bal gyi spu'am /
analyzed: gang gis sems can dmyal ba de dag gi lus so sor khyer bar byed de / ji ltar rlung chen po shin tu mi bzad cing rtsub pas ras bal gyi spu'am /

analyzed: gang gis khyer ba'i ras bal de dag gi spu rnams rlung des phyogs bcur bdas shing khyer ba phan tshun thug pa de ltar sems can dmyal ba de dag gi lus sems can dmyal ba'i rlung spu gri lta bu des 'di ltar bye ma'i tshad tsam du'ang mi🔽mngon par khyer ro //
translated: In the same way, the hell beings’ bodies are carried away by the hell wind that is like a razor, so that not even an amount the size of a grain of sand remains.

original: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas gal te brgya la de'i rlung gi gnod pa las thar na de la byi ba mche ba rdo rje lta bu yod pa 'byung la gang de'i rku ba yungs 'bru tsam du @392b rlog ste /
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas gal te brgya la de'i rlung gi gnod pa las thar na de la byi ba mche ba rdo rje lta bu yod pa 'byung la gang de'i rku ba yungs 'bru tsam du @392b rlog ste /

original: brlags nas du skad 'don bzhin du za bar byed do //
analyzed: brlags nas du skad 'don bzhin du za bar byed do //

original: de zos nas rgyu ma dag za'o //

analyzed: long ka de dag zos nas rgyab tu 'byung la de'i rgal tshigs za ste /

analyzed: de ltar de'i las kyi mthus sems can dmyal ba de lo 'bum phrag du mar sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //

original: de gal te de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gal te de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he should escape from that hell,

original: de'i yun ring mo zhig 'das nas gal te nyon mongs pa de las thar nas de gar bab bab tu 'bros so //
analyzed: de'i yun ring mo zhig 'das nas gal te nyon mongs pa de las thar nas de gar bab bab tu 'bros so //

analyzed: de nas rang gi lus las byung ba'i srog chags mar ko ta ka rnams kyis gang zhing de'i rkub kyang de nas 'cha' zhing za'o //

original: de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du srog chags mar ko ta ka de rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pas du bar byed de /🔽'o dod 'bod /
analyzed: de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du srog chags mar ko ta ka de rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pas du bar byed de / 'o dod 'bod /

original: sgra skad 'byin /
analyzed: sgra skad 'byin /
translated: make noise,

original: smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don to //
translated: and wail.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, he will escape from that hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs stong phrag du mar yi dvags rang gi sha la za bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs stong phrag du mar yi dvags rang gi sha la za bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having been freed from that, due to the causally concordant experiential effects of that karma, for many thousands of lives he will be born as a hungry ghost who eats his own flesh.

original: ji ltar de'i tshe des bdag nyid kyi bud med ma yin pa la mi tshangs par spyod pas rang gi sha la za ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i tshe des bdag nyid kyi bud med ma yin pa la mi tshangs par spyod pas rang gi sha la za ste /

analyzed: des bdag nyid 'tsho bar byed do //

original: gal te brgya la yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar nas kyang de phag gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brgya la yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar nas kyang de phag gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he somehow escapes from the hungry ghost realm, he will be born in the womb of a pig.

original: ji ltar des rang gi ma dag la chos ma yin pa byas @393a *//
analyzed: ji ltar des rang gi ma dag la chos ma yin pa byas @393a *//
translated: Just as he engaged in non-Dharma with his own mother,

original: pas gang du skyes par rang gi mas za bar byed do //
analyzed: pas gang du skyes par rang gi mas za bar byed do //

analyzed: gal te brgya la de'i chung ma zhig yod par gyur na'ang ji ltar pha rol gyi bud med 'os pa ma yin par phrogs pa ltar /

analyzed: de'ang rung ba ma yin pa'i mi dag gis de 'phrog par byed de /

original: mi'i don 'di thams cad med par byed pa ni /
analyzed: mi'i don 'di thams cad med par byed pa ni /
translated: All these human goals will be destroyed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang 'gal ba 'os pa ma yin pa'i drung du 'gro ba'o //
translated: they have gone to unwholesome people who are in conflict with the Dharma, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor sems can dmyal ba shar gyur pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: By means of knowledge derived from hearing, he sees that the hell known as All Suffering is a neighboring realm of the great Reviving Hell.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod par log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te @393b mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod par log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te @393b mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and so come to understand that such a birth is caused by resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, taking what was not given, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, lying, and wrong view.

original: bud med sdom pa blangs pa gang gis 'os pa ma yin pa'i dge slong dbang du byas te /
analyzed: bud med sdom pa blangs pa gang gis 'os pa ma yin pa'i dge slong dbang du byas te /

translated: If someone were to give alcohol to someone else, causing them to lose their mind and become distressed, then upon separating from the body, they would fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as All-Pervading Torment.

analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te / gang gis rtag tu tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'os pa ma yin pa la 'os pa nyid du goms par byed na / de rtag tu mi dge bar zhugs pa des lam ngan pa de nyid rjes su bstan par byed do //
translated: “The beings in that realm experience all the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell and so forth.🔽Those who constantly engage in unwholesome conduct and who habituate themselves to what is inappropriate will be taught the wrong path.🔽They will be taught the wrong path and habituated to it.

original: las kyi gzhi ngan pa byas pa'i ngang tshul can mi dge ba'i las kyi mtha' dpyad pa des mi dge ba'i lam de rjes su bsten cing goms par byed do //

original: sems can dmyal ba de sdug bsngal ches drag pa dang / sdug bsngal ches mi bzad pa dang / sdug bsngal ches rtsub cing tsha ba dag shin tu so sor myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba de sdug bsngal ches drag pa dang / sdug bsngal ches mi bzad pa dang / sdug bsngal ches rtsub cing tsha ba dag shin tu so sor myong bar 'gyur te /

original: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /

original: 'di lta ste /

original: rkang pa'i mthe bo la sogs pa nas mgo'i bar du mtshon cha hu lu rab tu 'bar ba dag gis sha ma gtogs par bags pa gcod par byed de /🔽de ltar de'i yan lag dang / @394a *//

analyzed: nyid lag thams cad dang / pags pa dag gcod par byed pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad do //

analyzed: de'i pags pa de dag kyang sa'i nang du bcug nas sreg par byed de /

original: de'i lus pags pa med pa'i lus de dag la gshin rje'i mi de rnams kyis lcags kyi snod kyi nang dub tshva rab tu bskol pa khyer nas ldugs par byed de /

analyzed: de ltar lo 'bum phrag du mar sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur zhing lo bgrang gis mi lang ba'i bar du myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way they will experience suffering for many hundreds of thousands of years, for innumerable years.

original: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal tsha ba shin tu mi bzad pas gdungs so //

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,

analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: Book 14

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
