translated: “The beings in that realm experience the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell, and so forth, and they experience additional particular tortures. analyzed: gsheg par byed /🔽'tshed par byed /
translated: and boiled.

analyzed: yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad phan tshun 'bral bar byed do //

analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad cing tsha la rtsub pa gzhan dang mtshungs pa med pa'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //

translated: Obscured by that suffering, he runs here and there, and sees a great abyss filled with the river Vaitaraṇī, the “unfordable,” which is extremely hot and filled with snakes that have arisen from his karma.

analyzed: der sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa des 'khrul par mthong ste /

analyzed: mi mtho 'tsham par byed pa de rnams kyis de rab tu so sor phye nas sprul gdug pa rnams kyis za bar byed de /

original: sbrul gdug pa'i mche ba rnon po rnams kyis kun nas shin tu sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa de /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa'i mche ba rnon po rnams kyis kun nas shin tu sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa de /

translated: He cries out, wails, and laments until finally his negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis de las yun ring mo zhig 'das shing lo bgrang gis mi lang ba na thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis de las yun ring mo zhig 'das shing lo bgrang gis mi lang ba na thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: After a very long time, an incalculable number of years, he is freed from that hell.

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /

original: mi byad gzugs rta rgod ma 'dra zhing tshang tshing gangs ri lta bu'i nang du skye la /
analyzed: mi byad gzugs rta rgod ma 'dra zhing tshang tshing gangs ri lta bu'i nang du skye la /

original: der kha zas 'bras bu'i rtsa ba 'ba' zhig gis 'tsho bar byed de /
analyzed: der kha zas 'bras bu'i rtsa ba 'ba' zhig gis 'tsho bar byed de /
translated: There, they will survive on a diet of fruit roots alone.

analyzed: de gzhan las skyes pa'i kha zas nam yang mngon par shes par mi 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba rtag tu mun pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas @396a *//🔽pas 'gyur ro //

translated: “What are those ten? They are killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, lying, and wrong view, and the other four are the ten unwholesome courses of action.🔽“What are the ten wholesome courses of action?

original: phyi rol ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de phyis 'dod chags mngon par spangs te 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dang bral ba de bud med dag gis bslus nas yang 'dod pa rnams la 'jug par byed na /

translated: “When a non-Buddhist ascetic who is free from desire later abandons desire and becomes free from desire, hatred, and delusion, he may be deceived by women and again engage in desire.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rtag tu mun pa zhes bya bar skyes bar 'gyur ro; ;der skyes nas kyang gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa drag pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rtag tu mun pa zhes bya bar skyes bar 'gyur ro; ;der skyes nas kyang gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa drag pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung
translated: When he later separates from his body, he will fall into the lower realms, into the hell known as Constant Darkness. The beings in that realm experience the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell, and so forth, increased a thousandfold.

original: ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar srin bu sa rko zhes bya ba dag gis de ji ltar dbu ba la 'bigs pa de ltar mchu rdo rje ltar rno ba de dag sems can dmyal ba pa de'i nyes par byas pa'i las des 'byung

analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal bsdus pa de dag thams cad de ltar brgya'i cha dang / stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi char yang mi phod de /

analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid de dag las thar bar byed mi nus so //

analyzed: // de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas zhing bsags pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du 'tshed do //

analyzed: de ltar 'o skol shin tu dgyes par 'gyur zhing gzhan gyis kyang mi tshor bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du gnod pa khyad par du 'byung ba dag ni 'di ltar gshin rje'i mi dag gis bud @397b med de bzung ste btsir btsir nas bags

analyzed: pa 'thog par byed do //

analyzed: rnam par gsheg par byed; yongs su 'bral bar byed do //

analyzed: sems 'dod pas bsgribs pa sems kyis yongs su bslus pa de de'i drung nyid du rgyug la /

translated: Thus, the one who desires that will run to the place of the difficult-to-conquer enemy, and when he meets him, he will be completely digested.

analyzed: de'ang me thab tu gyur nas kun nas rab tu 'bar ba der de rab tu 'jug par byed do //

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba snying rje med pa'i sar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell of the Ground of No Mercy.

original: der skyes nas gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar de dag sa'i steng du phung po brtsegs mar byas te /
analyzed: der skyes nas gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar de dag sa'i steng du phung po brtsegs mar byas te /
translated: “The beings born there experience all the combined tortures of the Reviving Hell, and so forth, but with one difference: there, the beings are piled up in heaps on the ground.

original: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi zangs kyis gzhi rab tu bsregs par brgya'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi zangs kyis gzhi rab tu bsregs par brgya'am /

original: yang na stong gcig gi steng du gcig phung por byas pa ni ji ltar skra'i rtse mo la skabs med pa de ltar gcig gi steng @404a *//
analyzed: yang na stong gcig gi steng du gcig phung por byas pa ni ji ltar skra'i rtse mo la skabs med pa de ltar gcig gi steng @404a *//
translated: They will be piled up in heaps, one on top of the other, so that there is no space between them, like the tip of a hair.

original: du gcig bsdus nas sreg go /
analyzed: du gcig bsdus nas sreg go /
translated: In this way, they will be burned one on top of the other.

original: de ltar de dag gcig gi steng du gcig bcer bas gnod pa na ji ltar de dag gcig gi steng du gcig shin tu thags dam par bcer ba'i bar mi mngon pa de ltar bsdu bar byas nas gshin rje'i mi rnams tho ba thogs te kun tu 'tshog
analyzed: de ltar de dag gcig gi steng du gcig bcer bas gnod pa na ji ltar de dag gcig gi steng du gcig shin tu thags dam par bcer ba'i bar mi mngon pa de ltar bsdu bar byas nas gshin rje'i mi rnams tho ba thogs te kun tu 'tshog
translated: they will press them together so that the space between them disappears.

original: go / de ltar ji srid du sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar sdug bsngal mi bzad pa tsha ba rtsub pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go / de ltar ji srid du sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar sdug bsngal mi bzad pa tsha ba rtsub pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will experience unbearable suffering for many hundreds of thousands of years until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When they finally escape this hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs dgu brgyar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs dgu brgyar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will, as an effect that accords with their causal actions, be born nine hundred times as a starving spirit or an animal.

original: de las thar nas gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: de las thar nas gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If they escape this and are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de dbul zhing nad bu can dang / 'gran zla gzhan gyis bsad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dbul zhing nad bu can dang / 'gran zla gzhan gyis bsad par 'gyur /
translated: They will be poor and sickly, and their rivals will kill them.

original: yul ngan par chu 'gram gyi mi kla klor skye bar 'gyur te /🔽der yang thams cad kyi tha mar 'gyur zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul ngan par chu 'gram gyi mi kla klor skye bar 'gyur te / der yang thams cad kyi tha mar 'gyur zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will be born as barbarians on the banks of rivers in uncivilized lands.

original: de nas gzhan yang /🔽dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang / dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: There, too, they will be the lowest of the low and will have short lives.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba shing skam bsdus pa lta bu zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba shing skam bsdus pa lta bu zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Intense Heat, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive a neighboring realm of the great hell of Intense Heat known as Like a Bundle of Dry Sticks.

original: der @404b sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: der @404b sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people who are not celibate monks pretend to be celibate monks.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //🔽mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa byin pa'i chung ma nyes pa med par 'phrog pa ni de gsod pa'i sar khrid cing bsad du dogs pa ni gang gis srog phyung ste /
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba dang / log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro // mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa byin pa'i chung ma nyes pa med par 'phrog pa ni de gsod pa'i sar khrid cing bsad du dogs pa ni gang gis srog phyung ste /
translated: “What are they? They are killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, lying, and wrong views.

original: mi de btang ba las des kyang drin med par byas nas de'i chung ma 'phrog par byed na /
analyzed: mi de btang ba las des kyang drin med par byas nas de'i chung ma 'phrog par byed na /
translated: “When someone gives protection to a man whose wife has been taken away, and that man, out of ingratitude, takes that benefactor’s wife,

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba shing skam bsdus pa lta bur skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba shing skam bsdus pa lta bur skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when the body of that man, who has committed adultery with an ungrateful mind, disintegrates, he will fall into the lower realms, into the hell known as Like a Bundle of Dry Sticks.

original: der skyes nas gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba de chu bo sgra chen zhes bya ba de'i nang du 'jug par byed
analyzed: der skyes nas gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsdus pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba de chu bo sgra chen zhes bya ba de'i nang du 'jug par byed
translated: That hell being enters the great river called Loud Sound.

original: do // des sems can dmyal ba pa brgya stong du ma dag kyang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: do // des sems can dmyal ba pa brgya stong du ma dag kyang 'jug par byed do //
translated: It causes many hundreds of thousands of hell beings to enter.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gi nang du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gi nang du 'jug par byed do //
translated: It causes those hell beings to enter.

original: de de ltar de dag gi nang du zhugs shing shugs drag pos bdas pa rnams kyi 'og tu bcug nas de ji ltar skra'i rtse mo tsam yang mi omngon pa de ltar de dag gis steng nas steng du 'dus nas gnod par byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar de dag gi nang du zhugs shing shugs drag pos bdas pa rnams kyi 'og tu bcug nas de ji ltar skra'i rtse mo tsam yang mi omngon pa de ltar de dag gis steng nas steng du 'dus nas gnod par byed de /
translated: Having entered there, it pushes them down with great force, and then it piles them up on top of each other, causing them harm, so that not even the tip of a hair is visible.

original: de'i steng na sems can dmyal ba pa rnams @405a *//
analyzed: de'i steng na sems can dmyal ba pa rnams @405a *//
translated: Above them, the hell beings🔽are arranged.

original: 'khod do // 'og tu ni zha nye rab tu bskol bas 'tshed cing sreg la gsod do //
analyzed: 'khod do // 'og tu ni zha nye rab tu bskol bas 'tshed cing sreg la gsod do //
translated: Below, they are boiled, burned, and killed by boiling lead.

original: chos  nges 'debs shing rtag tu sdug bsngal bas nyam thag ste /
analyzed: chos  nges 'debs shing rtag tu sdug bsngal bas nyam thag ste /
translated: They are always tormented by suffering and by the certainty of the Dharma.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal bas nyam thag pa phyir zhing las kyis byas pa'i chu srin dag nye bar 'ong ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal bas nyam thag pa phyir zhing las kyis byas pa'i chu srin dag nye bar 'ong ste /
translated: Thus, tormented by suffering, the nāga-like creatures created by karma come to them.

original: gang dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa de yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad za zhing 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa de yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad za zhing 'byung ngo //
translated: They eat all the major and minor body parts of the hell beings and then leave.

original: de shing skam ltar bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba na ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yun ring por las kyis byas pa'i tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shing skam ltar bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba na ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yun ring por las kyis byas pa'i tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As they experience the suffering of being consumed like dry wood, for a long time they experience the unbearable feelings created by karma until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they finally escape this hell,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs lnga brgyar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe rabs lnga brgyar yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will, as an effect that accords with their causal actions, be born five hundred times as a starving spirit or an animal.

original: de de las thar nas kyang gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: de de las thar nas kyang gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should escape and be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de bud med kun gyi yid chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bud med kun gyi yid chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they will be born as a woman who is unattractive to everyone.

original: de ji ltar bu'i de ba dang / pha'i ngo bo dang / ming po'i ngo bo lta bu dang / tshe rabs lnga brgyar pho mtshan dang bral bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ji ltar bu'i de ba dang / pha'i ngo bo dang / ming po'i ngo bo lta bu dang / tshe rabs lnga brgyar pho mtshan dang bral bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will be like a hermaphrodite, a eunuch, or a castrated animal, and for five hundred lifetimes they will be devoid of genitals.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na /🔽des 'khor bcu drug pa dag las bcu @405b bdun pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i 'khor la brtags na / des 'khor bcu drug pa dag las bcu @405b bdun pa ma mthong ste /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions will examine the regions that surround the great Hell of Intense Heat.🔽He will not see a seventeenth region, but the great hell of Intense Heat is surrounded by sixteen regions.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu che ba ni 'khor bcu drug dag gis yongs su bskor to //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu che ba ni 'khor bcu drug dag gis yongs su bskor to //
translated: The great hell of Intense Heat is thus surrounded by sixteen regions.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i mi bzad pa chen po ni de dag yin /🔽mjug ni de dag yin /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i mi bzad pa chen po ni de dag yin / mjug ni de dag yin /
translated: The great hell of Intense Heat is extremely terrible.🔽It is the end, the culmination.

original: mtha' ni de dag yin te /
analyzed: mtha' ni de dag yin te /
translated: It is the limit.

original: de rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sa la spyod pa'i mi dag 'tshed cing sreg ste /
analyzed: de rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sa la spyod pa'i mi dag 'tshed cing sreg ste /
translated: They are cooked and burned by the people who experience the results of their own actions.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis byas pa 'thob pa ma yin pa las dang mthun par gnod pa myong ngo /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis byas pa 'thob pa ma yin pa las dang mthun par gnod pa myong ngo /
translated: Thus, they experience harm in accordance with their own actions, but not the actions of others.

original: de rang gis byas pa chud za bar mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis byas pa dang phrad pa med de /
analyzed: de rang gis byas pa chud za bar mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis byas pa dang phrad pa med de /
translated: One’s own actions are not wasted, and one does not encounter the actions of others.

original: byas pa chud za bar mi 'gyur zhing rang gis byas pa dang mthun par 'bras bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud za bar mi 'gyur zhing rang gis byas pa dang mthun par 'bras bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s own actions are not wasted, and the results of one’s own actions will occur.

original: rang gis byas pa'i skye gnas las skyes pa'i sems can dag ni rang gi las la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i skye gnas las skyes pa'i sems can dag ni rang gi las la spyod pa yin te /
translated: “ ‘Sentient beings who are born in accordance with their own actions experience their own actions.

original: 'di ltar dge ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'am /
translated: Thus, whether their actions are virtuous

original: sdig pa'i las su 'gyur ba de'i las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las su 'gyur ba de'i las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa yin no //
translated: or nonvirtuous, they experience the results of their own actions.

original: de ltar dge slong de sems can dmyal ba rnams la sems can dmyal bar gtogs pa'i las rjes su sems pa srid pa mngon par grub pa la cung zad kyang bde ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de sems can dmyal ba rnams la sems can dmyal bar gtogs pa'i las rjes su sems pa srid pa mngon par grub pa la cung zad kyang bde ba med de /
translated: “ ‘Thus, the monk who reflects on the karmic actions of the beings in hell will understand that the formation of existence is not the slightest bit happy.

original: rtag pa med la ther zug pa med cing bdag dang bcas pa ma yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: rtag pa med la ther zug pa med cing bdag dang bcas pa ma yin par mthong ste /
translated: He sees that it is impermanent, not permanent; that it is suffering, not happiness; that it is empty, not full; and that it is not self, but has no self.

original: 'khor ba thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that the whole of cyclic existence is impermanent, suffering, empty, and not self.

original: de de ltar mthong ba na /🔽'dod pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod pa so sor @406a *//
analyzed: de de ltar mthong ba na / 'dod pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod pa so sor @406a *//
translated: When he sees in this way,

original: 'brang ba dang / 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dag la rab tu 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brang ba dang / 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dag la rab tu 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes free from desire for all desires, from the fetters of desire, from the pursuit of desire, from the conceptualization of desire, and from the basis of desire.

original: de phyir zhing yang 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs dag la ches shin tu 'jigs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyir zhing yang 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs dag la ches shin tu 'jigs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes even more afraid of the dangers of desire.

original: de ltar lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi g-yo ba shin tu bsdams pa de la bdud dang / bdud kyi 'khor gyis rab tu mi tshugs so //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi g-yo ba shin tu bsdams pa de la bdud dang / bdud kyi 'khor gyis rab tu mi tshugs so //
translated: Thus, when the movements of his body, speech, and mind are well restrained, he is not harmed by Māra or Māra’s retinue.

original: de lta de ltar goms par byed pa de 'khor ba'i tshe rabs mang po'i rgyud zhigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta de ltar goms par byed pa de 'khor ba'i tshe rabs mang po'i rgyud zhigs par 'gyur /
translated: As he practices in this way, his continuum of births in cyclic existence is severed.

original: bsrabs par 'gyur /🔽spangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsrabs par 'gyur / spangs par 'gyur /
translated: it will be reduced,🔽abandoned,

original: lhod lhod por 'gyur ro //🔽de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i dge slong 'di ni /🔽kye ma spro ba ma bri ba yin te /
analyzed: lhod lhod por 'gyur ro // de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i dge slong 'di ni / kye ma spro ba ma bri ba yin te /
translated: and relaxed.🔽“The monk who is a spiritual practitioner and who carefully observes inner phenomena will then think, ‘Ah! This person has not lost his enthusiasm and has thus entered the eleventh ground.’

original: sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa yin no snyam mo; ;de ltar spro ba ma bri ba de la sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag dga' nas bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa yin no snyam mo; ;de ltar spro ba ma bri ba de la sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag dga' nas bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: The earth-dwelling yakṣas will be delighted by this person’s undiminished enthusiasm and will inform the sky-dwelling yakṣas.

original: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi pa dag la mngon par bsnyad pa nas snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi pa dag la mngon par bsnyad pa nas snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The latter will then inform the Four Great Kings, and so forth, as before.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha'i bar dag la 'di ltar dzambu'i gling du rigs che ge mo zhig las rigs kyi bu zhig grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / ming ga ge mo zhig ces bya ba skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha'i bar dag la 'di ltar dzambu'i gling du rigs che ge mo zhig las rigs kyi bu zhig grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / ming ga ge mo zhig ces bya ba skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te /
translated: up to the Brahmakāyika gods, “In Jambudvīpa, a son of such-and-such a family, from such-and-such a village, from such-and-such a town, named such-and-such, has shaved off his hair and beard, put on saffron robes,

original: dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ba de bdud @406b kyi yul gyi dngos po mi 'dod cing 'dod chags kyi dga' ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sred pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod /
analyzed: dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ba de bdud @406b kyi yul gyi dngos po mi 'dod cing 'dod chags kyi dga' ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sred pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod /
translated: and with faith has gone forth from home to homelessness. He does not desire the things of Māra’s domain, and he does not desire to live together with the things that are the craving born from the delights of desire.

original: nyon mongs pa sprul lta bu dang lhan cig dga' bar mi byed la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sprul lta bu dang lhan cig dga' bar mi byed la /
translated: He does not delight in the afflictions that are like a snake.

original: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa dag mthong nas 'khor ba thams cad las yid byung ngo zhes mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa dag mthong nas 'khor ba thams cad las yid byung ngo zhes mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: Seeing the afflictions of others, he has become disenchanted with the whole of saṃsāra.”

original: de thos nas tshangs chen gyi ris kyi lha rnams bdud kyi phyogs ni dma' bar gyur te //
analyzed: de thos nas tshangs chen gyi ris kyi lha rnams bdud kyi phyogs ni dma' bar gyur te //
translated: Having heard this, the gods of the Mahā-Brahmā class said, “The side of Māra has become low,🔽and the side of the Dharma has become high.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho'o zhes dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho'o zhes dga' ba skyes so //
translated: The side of the sacred Dharma is exalted.”

original: de ltar sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de ltar sa gzhan bcu gcig pa la zhugs pa /
translated: In this way, he enters the eleventh ground.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lha'i mthong ba dang yang dag pa'i lam mthong ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lha'i mthong ba dang yang dag pa'i lam mthong ba /
translated: He sees the divine vision of the spiritual practitioner and the true path.

original: las kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa shes pa /
analyzed: las kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa shes pa /
translated: He understands the ripening of karmic phenomena.

original: lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa'i de kho na nyid mthong ba de 'di snyam du sems te; 'di ltar lus gyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa shin tu zhib mor rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na /
analyzed: lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa'i de kho na nyid mthong ba de 'di snyam du sems te; 'di ltar lus gyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa shin tu zhib mor rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na /
translated: He sees the reality of physical punishment, verbal punishment, and mental punishment. He thinks, ‘When I thoroughly and precisely discern physical punishment, verbal punishment, and mental punishment,

original: dge slong dag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / skye dgur bcas pa dang / lha dang mir bcas pa dag gis de ltar rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi shes na /
analyzed: dge slong dag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / skye dgur bcas pa dang / lha dang mir bcas pa dag gis de ltar rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi shes na /
translated: monks, the world with its gods, Māra, Brahmā, renunciants, and brahmins, with its beings including humans and gods, does not know this discernment.

original: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba pa dag gis shes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba pa dag gis shes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much less so the tīrthikas and wandering mendicants!

original: gnas med cing skabs med la /
analyzed: gnas med cing skabs med la /
translated: There is no basis for it, no opportunity for it.

original: nga'i slob ma dang / gang nga las thos pa ni ma gtogs so snyam mo //
analyzed: nga'i slob ma dang / gang nga las thos pa ni ma gtogs so snyam mo //
translated: Except for my disciples and those who have heard it from me.

original: de ltar @407a *//
analyzed: de ltar @407a *//
translated: In this way,

original: chad pa gsum shin tu phra ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de ni de ltar shin tu phra ba yin no //
analyzed: chad pa gsum shin tu phra ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de ni de ltar shin tu phra ba yin no //
translated: this extremely subtle discernment of the three types of cessation is extremely subtle.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag gis dris na lan de ltar gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag gis dris na lan de ltar gdab par bya'o //
translated: if the tīrthikas ask you this, you should answer in this way.

original: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag ni dris pa'i lan la shin tu rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag ni dris pa'i lan la shin tu rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The tīrthikas will be confused by the answer.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: 'di ltar 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because it is not the domain of any being in saṃsāra.

original: de dag gi lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po de ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po de ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: The three types of cessation of the body, speech, and mind are reasonable.

original: nyes pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas pa /
translated: They are flawed,🔽defiled,

original: dri ma dang bcas pa /🔽khyad du gsod pa dang bcas pa la sems pa yin /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa / khyad du gsod pa dang bcas pa la sems pa yin /
translated: and contemptible.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par gcod pa ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par gcod pa ma yin /
translated: They do not eliminate birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, or unhappiness.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi chos mngon sum du byed pa'ang ma yin /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi chos mngon sum du byed pa'ang ma yin / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa ma yin /
translated: They do not actualize the Dharma of the noble ones.🔽They do not reach the end of suffering.

original: gtan zad par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gtan zad par byed pa ma yin /
translated: They do not bring about the complete exhaustion of suffering.

original: zhi ba ma yin /
analyzed: zhi ba ma yin /
translated: They are not peace.

original: bde ba ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba ma yin /
translated: They are not happiness.

original: lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar byed pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar byed pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: They do not lead to rebirth in the celestial realms.

original: de dag lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po la sems par byed do //
analyzed: de dag lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po la sems par byed do //
translated: They think about the three kinds of punishments: physical, verbal, and mental.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag ni rang gi lus kyis mgu nas nga rgyal 'ba' zhig byed par @407b zad de /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba dag ni rang gi lus kyis mgu nas nga rgyal 'ba' zhig byed par @407b zad de /
translated: the tīrthikas are satisfied with their own bodies and only give rise to pride.

original: skyon dang / yon tan dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: skyon dang / yon tan dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not analyze faults and qualities.

original: de ltar lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni mi bzad pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni mi bzad pa chen po yin te /
translated: Thus, these three—the punishments of body, speech, and mind—are great and unbearable.

original: de dag dang / nga'i dang / cung zad kyang 'dra ba med pa ni /
analyzed: de dag dang / nga'i dang / cung zad kyang 'dra ba med pa ni /
translated: They are not at all like mine.

original: dper na / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba gnyis cung zad kyang mi 'dra ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba gnyis cung zad kyang mi 'dra ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, nirvana and saṃsāra are not at all alike.

original: de ltar de dag gi chad pa rnam pa gsum dang / nga'i dang 'dra ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi chad pa rnam pa gsum dang / nga'i dang 'dra ba med do //
translated: Thus, their three punishments are not at all like mine.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: de de ltar lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de de ltar lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: you should answer like this.

original: phas kyi rgol ba dag gi ni stong pa yin la /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dag gi ni stong pa yin la /
translated: The opponents’ is empty,

original: nga'i lam ni bde ba yin no //
analyzed: nga'i lam ni bde ba yin no //
translated: but my path is happiness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is peace.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: All conditioned things are moving.

original: 'khor ba thams cad na bde ba med de /
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad na bde ba med de /
translated: There is no happiness in all of saṃsāra.

original: gang rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can de dag la de ltar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can de dag la de ltar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think of them in this way.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: de ltar lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i dge slong de ni che ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i dge slong de ni che ba yin no //
translated: a bhikṣu who sees the reality of the three kinds of punishments—those of the body, speech, and mind—is a great one.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong thar pa'i grong khyer gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'ang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong thar pa'i grong khyer gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de'ang rtog par byed de /
translated: A bhikṣu who is a practitioner of yoga and who sees the reality of the city of liberation also thinks,

original: dge slong de ji ltar na sa gzhan bcu gnyis pa la zhugs zhig gu snyam nas rnal 'byor spyod pa des brtags na /
analyzed: dge slong de ji ltar na sa gzhan bcu gnyis pa la zhugs zhig gu snyam nas rnal 'byor spyod pa des brtags na /
translated: ‘How is it that this bhikṣu has entered the twelfth stage?’

original: dge slong 'di ni brtson pa ma bri ba yin la da dung du las ngan pa byas pa rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni brtson pa ma bri ba yin la da dung du las ngan pa byas pa rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la rtog par byed de /
translated: The practitioner of yoga examines this and sees that this bhikṣu is not slacking in his efforts but is still contemplating the reality of the causes and effects of bad actions.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po bdud kyi 'khor dmyal ba @408a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po bdud kyi 'khor dmyal ba @408a *//
translated: He sees that this bhikṣu is in the great hell of the māras,

original: mnar med pa zhes bya ba stong 'gyur du 'byung ba mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: mnar med pa zhes bya ba stong 'gyur du 'byung ba mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: He sees the hell of Ultimate Torment, which is a thousand leagues in size.🔽What karma causes beings to take birth there?

original: gang gis bsam bzhin du ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / bskal pa'i lhag mar gnas par 'gyur ba ni gang bskal pa'i tha mar nyes par byas pa'i las byas pa mnar med par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bskal pa'i lhag ma der smin to /
analyzed: gang gis bsam bzhin du ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / bskal pa'i lhag mar gnas par 'gyur ba ni gang bskal pa'i tha mar nyes par byas pa'i las byas pa mnar med par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bskal pa'i lhag ma der smin to /
translated: He examines this with knowledge derived from hearing and sees that those who intentionally kill their father, kill their mother, or kill an arhat will remain there for an eon.

original: gnod pa gang 'gags pa'i dus ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gnod pa gang 'gags pa'i dus ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: The harm that is blocked will not occur again.

original: de lta bas na byas pas bskal pa'i lhag mar smin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na byas pas bskal pa'i lhag mar smin te /
translated: Thus, the harm that is created remains for the remainder of the eon.

original: las khyad par can byas pas gnod pa drag pa rtsub pa tsha ba khyad par can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las khyad par can byas pas gnod pa drag pa rtsub pa tsha ba khyad par can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the special karma that is created, the harm that occurs is also special, intense, and severe.

original: gang mnar med pa'i las gcig byas pas ni sems la gnod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mnar med pa'i las gcig byas pas ni sems la gnod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: However, the harm that is created by a single act of Ultimate Torment does not occur in the mind.

original: 'jam zhing bsam pa 'jam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jam zhing bsam pa 'jam par 'gyur la /
translated: Their bodies and minds are soft and gentle.

original: 'di ltar mnar med pa 'di'i las gcig cig byas na gal te yang sems rtsub cing sems kyi bsam pa rtsub na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnar med pa 'di'i las gcig cig byas na gal te yang sems rtsub cing sems kyi bsam pa rtsub na /
translated: If they commit a single action in Avīci, but their minds are not rough and their mental intentions are not rough,

original: de'i sdug bsngal drag pa dang / rtsub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal drag pa dang / rtsub par 'gyur te /
translated: then their suffering will not be intense and rough.

original: de'i gnod pa rnam pa de lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnod pa rnam pa de lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The harm will not be of that kind.

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa thams cad ni sems la rag las te sems kyi dbang du song zhing sems kyi kun tu sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa thams cad ni sems la rag las te sems kyi dbang du song zhing sems kyi kun tu sbyor ba yin no //
translated: All the results of actions that are experienced as ripening are dependent on the mind. They are under the power of the mind and are connected to the mind.

original: sems kyi kun tu sbyor bas 'ching ba'i sems can dag ni bcings pa yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi kun tu sbyor bas 'ching ba'i sems can dag ni bcings pa yin la /
translated: Those sentient beings who are bound by the fetters of the mind are bound.

original: sems rnam par byang bas ni @408b grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par byang bas ni @408b grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those whose minds are purified are liberated.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mnar med pa rnams kyi gnod pa'i rim pa'ang de ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mnar med pa rnams kyi gnod pa'i rim pa'ang de ltar 'byung ste /
translated: The order of the harm in Avīci arises in that way.

original: de'i sdug bsngal ba'ang lus sbom zhing gzhon sha can du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal ba'ang lus sbom zhing gzhon sha can du 'byung ngo //
translated: The suffering there also arises for those whose bodies are large and tender.

original: de la mtshams med pa lnga'i las kyi sa ni lus dpag tshad lngar 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la mtshams med pa lnga'i las kyi sa ni lus dpag tshad lngar 'grub bo //
translated: The karmic action of the five heinous acts results in a body five yojanas tall.

original: las bzhis ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: las bzhis ni bzhi'o //
translated: The four karmic actions result in a body four yojanas tall.

original: las gsum gyis ni gsum mo //
analyzed: las gsum gyis ni gsum mo //
translated: The three karmic actions result in a body three yojanas tall.

original: las gnyis kyis ni gnyis so //
analyzed: las gnyis kyis ni gnyis so //
translated: The two karmic actions result in a body two yojanas tall.

original: las gcig gis ni lus dpag tshad gcig 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las gcig gis ni lus dpag tshad gcig 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The single karmic action results in a body one yojana tall.

original: de nas yang dge slong des sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i 'khor la brtags te /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong des sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i 'khor la brtags te /
translated: Then, the monk examines the retinue of the great Avīci hell.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i 'khor 'di ni spu zing zhes byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i 'khor 'di ni spu zing zhes byed pa yin no //
translated: This retinue of the great hell is terrifying.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba'i 'khor bcu drug pa ji ltar 'dug pa bzhin mthong ste /
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba'i 'khor bcu drug pa ji ltar 'dug pa bzhin mthong ste /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he sees that the sixteen surrounding hells are arranged as follows:

original: gang dag gis sems can dmyal ba chen po de yongs su bskor ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis sems can dmyal ba chen po de yongs su bskor ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: They surround the great hell.

original: bya rog kha zhes bya ba dang / sa kun gyi 'og dang / tshor ba mtha' med ring dang / wa ltar sgra 'byin pa dang / lcags dang / lce sbyang za dang / bya rog lto dang / lus zhum dang / sgra 'jigs ston dang /
analyzed: bya rog kha zhes bya ba dang / sa kun gyi 'og dang / tshor ba mtha' med ring dang / wa ltar sgra 'byin pa dang / lcags dang / lce sbyang za dang / bya rog lto dang / lus zhum dang / sgra 'jigs ston dang /
translated: the one called Crow’s Mouth, the one called Below All Grounds, the one called Endless Feeling, the one called Howling Like a Fox, the one called Iron, the one called Eating Tongue, the one called Crow’s Belly, the one called Shriveled Body, the one called Showing Fearful Sounds,

original: me tog kha ma bye ba lta bu dang / ri brtsigs 'bab dang / chu sgra dang / 'gram dngar dang / sdug bsngal kun dkris dang / dri 'dod dang / lcags snam dang / 'gro ba med 'jig ste /
analyzed: me tog kha ma bye ba lta bu dang / ri brtsigs 'bab dang / chu sgra dang / 'gram dngar dang / sdug bsngal kun dkris dang / dri 'dod dang / lcags snam dang / 'gro ba med 'jig ste /
translated: the one called Like a Flower That Has Not Opened, the one called Falling Like a Stack of Bricks, the one called Water Sound, the one called Delightful Bank, the one called Entangled in Suffering, the one called Desiring Smell, the one called Iron Plate, and the one called Destruction Without Going.

original: 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i 'khor bcu drug yin no //🔽de nas yang dge @409a *//
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i 'khor bcu drug yin no // de nas yang dge @409a *//
translated: These are the sixteen surrounding hells of the great hell of Ultimate Torment.

original: slong des 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa nas srid pa bar mar skye ba'i bar la rtog ste /
analyzed: slong des 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa nas srid pa bar mar skye ba'i bar la rtog ste /
translated: Then, the monk will consider the time of death and so forth, up to the arising of the intermediate existence.

original: ji ltar na sems can dmyal ba pa mnar med par 'gro ba sdug bsngal las sdug bsngal nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can dmyal ba pa mnar med par 'gro ba sdug bsngal las sdug bsngal nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: “How do beings who are going to the hell of Ultimate Torment experience suffering after suffering?”

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis zil gyis non pa'i srog chags ngan pa byed pa byas pa dag ni mnar med par 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis zil gyis non pa'i srog chags ngan pa byed pa byas pa dag ni mnar med par 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: Those who are overcome by evil desire, hatred, and delusion, and who have done evil deeds, will go to Avīci Hell.

original: de la mnar med par ni kha cig 'di ltar de lha'i 'jig rten 'dod pa'i phyir mer 'jug par byed /
analyzed: de la mnar med par ni kha cig 'di ltar de lha'i 'jig rten 'dod pa'i phyir mer 'jug par byed /
translated: Some, desiring the world of the gods, enter the fire.

original: gang dag ri ngos g-yang sa las 'dor bar byed /
analyzed: gang dag ri ngos g-yang sa las 'dor bar byed /
translated: Some are thrown off cliffs.

original: gang dag chur 'jug par byed /
analyzed: gang dag chur 'jug par byed /
translated: Some are drowned.

original: gang dag zas mi sbyin pas gsod par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag zas mi sbyin pas gsod par byed de /
translated: Some are killed by not being given food.

original: lam ngan pas rnam par rmongs pa /
analyzed: lam ngan pas rnam par rmongs pa /
translated: They are confused by bad paths.

original: thos pa ngan pas rnam par bslus shing gti mug pa dag ma gsod par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa ngan pas rnam par bslus shing gti mug pa dag ma gsod par byed do //
translated: They are deceived by bad teachings and kill their mothers out of delusion.

original: kha cig mtho ris 'dod pas 'di ltar zas mi sbyin pas sam /
analyzed: kha cig mtho ris 'dod pas 'di ltar zas mi sbyin pas sam /
translated: Some, desiring heaven, think, “If I kill my mother by not giving her food,

original: ri la g-yang du gtong bas sam /
analyzed: ri la g-yang du gtong bas sam /
translated: by throwing her off a cliff,

original: mer 'jug pas sam /
analyzed: mer 'jug pas sam /
translated: by burning her,

original: chur 'jug pas ma bsad na mtho ris 'thob bo snyam nas de mtho ris la sred pas srog dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: chur 'jug pas ma bsad na mtho ris 'thob bo snyam nas de mtho ris la sred pas srog dang bral bar byed do //
translated: or by drowning her, I will attain heaven.” Desiring heaven, they kill their mothers.

original: kha cig ni zhe sdang ba sems mi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen gyis te; de ltar nyes pa gsum gyis zil gyis non pa'i srog chags dag gis srog gcod par byed pa ni mnar med par 'gro'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni zhe sdang ba sems mi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen gyis te; de ltar nyes pa gsum gyis zil gyis non pa'i srog chags dag gis srog gcod par byed pa ni mnar med par 'gro'o //
translated: Those beings who kill out of these three faults go to Avīci.🔽There, some, not knowing that Avīci is a great field, draw blood from it.

original: de la mnar med pa ni kha cig zhing chen por @409b gyur pa de ma shes nas khrag 'byin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun dbyen byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa'ang srog dang bral bar byed pa ni phyir zhing zhe sdang gis zil gyis non pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mnar med pa ni kha cig zhing chen por @409b gyur pa de ma shes nas khrag 'byin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun dbyen byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa'ang srog dang bral bar byed pa ni phyir zhing zhe sdang gis zil gyis non pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, some, out of hatred, create a schism in the Saṅgha, and some kill an arhat.

original: de ltar don thams cad med cing rab tu gcod pa byed pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar don thams cad med cing rab tu gcod pa byed pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do all these things, which are devoid of any good, and who commit the most terrible acts, are born in the great hell Avīci.

original: de dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe kha cig rang gi lus nyid la mnar med pa'i me gnas shing 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe kha cig rang gi lus nyid la mnar med pa'i me gnas shing 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: When they die, the fire of Avīci arises in some of them, burning their own bodies.

original: kha cig 'chi ba'i dus byas ma thag tu srid pa bar mar 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: kha cig 'chi ba'i dus byas ma thag tu srid pa bar mar 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Some die and immediately arise in the intermediate state.

original: de'i 'og tu mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then they are born in Avīci.

original: gang gi tshe mnar med pa'i las byas pa de'i tshe de phan chad rab tu 'byung ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bskal pa nges par bsregs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mnar med pa'i las byas pa de'i tshe de phan chad rab tu 'byung ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bskal pa nges par bsregs par 'gyur /
translated: When they commit the karma of Avīci, from then on they definitely burn up the karma to be experienced as a renunciate.

original: de'i sdom pa so sor skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sdom pa so sor skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not generate the vows.🔽They burn up the karma of virtuous action to be experienced as definite and indefinite, as well as that to be experienced in other lives and in the next life.

original: dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa bsregs pa myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba de nges par sems can dmyal bar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa bsregs pa myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba de nges par sems can dmyal bar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: They are born in hell.

original: de tshe thung bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de tshe thung bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They have a short life.

original: gang gis lo brgya thub par 'gyur ba de lo nyi shu zhig thub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis lo brgya thub par 'gyur ba de lo nyi shu zhig thub par 'gyur /
translated: Those who would live a hundred years live only twenty.

original: gang yid kyis rtog cing sems par byed pa de dag thams cad kyang ji ltar tshva sgo la sa bon btab pa bzhin 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yid kyis rtog cing sems par byed pa de dag thams cad kyang ji ltar tshva sgo la sa bon btab pa bzhin 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
translated: All the thoughts and intentions that arise in their minds will be fruitless, like seeds planted in salty soil.

original: de phan chad lha gang phyi bzhin du 'brang ba des de yongs su spong bar byed /
analyzed: de phan chad lha gang phyi bzhin du 'brang ba des de yongs su spong bar byed /
translated: The gods who follow them will abandon them.

original: de'i @410a *// las kyi mtha' 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i @410a *// las kyi mtha' 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
translated: Their actions will be fruitless.

original: de'i dbang po yul rnams la zhan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dbang po yul rnams la zhan par 'gyur /
translated: Their faculties will be weak with regard to their objects.

original: rtag tu rmi lam ngan pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu rmi lam ngan pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will always have bad dreams.

original: don med pa kun la'ang sbyor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: don med pa kun la'ang sbyor bar 'gyur /
translated: They will engage in all kinds of meaningless activities.

original: gal te de'i bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dag yod na de thams cad kyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de'i bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dag yod na de thams cad kyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
translated: If they have children, wives, male servants, or female servants, they will all abandon them.

original: rtag tu bkres pa dang / skom pas phongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu bkres pa dang / skom pas phongs par 'gyur /
translated: They will always be tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: gal te zas zhim po zhig sbyar na de'ang ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te zas zhim po zhig sbyar na de'ang ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur /
translated: If they prepare delicious food, it will not be as it should be.

original: skad kyang 'gag 'gag por 'gyur /
analyzed: skad kyang 'gag 'gag por 'gyur /
translated: Their voices will be hoarse.

original: rtag tu bzhin gyi mdog ngan cing rtsub pa dang; rtag tu sems 'khrul pa dang / rang gi nye du dang / gnyen 'dab kyi tshogs thams cad kyis kyang yongs su brnyas pa dang / de'i sems la glo bur du skrag pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu bzhin gyi mdog ngan cing rtsub pa dang; rtag tu sems 'khrul pa dang / rang gi nye du dang / gnyen 'dab kyi tshogs thams cad kyis kyang yongs su brnyas pa dang / de'i sems la glo bur du skrag pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Their minds will be suddenly seized by terror.

original: 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad dud pas 'khrigs par mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad dud pas 'khrigs par mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will see all the worlds filled with smoke.

original: de'i khams sngon ltar nam yang mnyam par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i khams sngon ltar nam yang mnyam par mi 'gyur /
translated: Their elements will never be in balance as they were before.

original: rgyang ring po na gzugs mi sdug pa med bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyang ring po na gzugs mi sdug pa med bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will see ugly forms in the distance, even though there are none.

original: rlung chung ngus ded par 'gyur /
analyzed: rlung chung ngus ded par 'gyur /
translated: They will be blown about by the slightest breeze.

original: rtag tu bdag nyid tsha bas gdungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu bdag nyid tsha bas gdungs par 'gyur /
translated: They will always feel as if they are being burned by fire.

original: rtag tu mkhris pa'i nad kyis nyam thag par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu mkhris pa'i nad kyis nyam thag par 'gyur /
translated: They will always be tormented by bile.

original: de'i kha rtag tu kha ba dang / lan tshva blo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i kha rtag tu kha ba dang / lan tshva blo bar 'gyur /
translated: Their mouths will always be dry and taste bitter.

original: mal gyi gzhi thams cad 'jam pa yin yang rtsub par 'gyur /
analyzed: mal gyi gzhi thams cad 'jam pa yin yang rtsub par 'gyur /
translated: Even though their bedding is soft, it will feel rough.

original: gling bu dang / 'khar rnga dang / rdza rnga dang / pi wang gi sgra dag kyang 'jigs shing bag @410b tsha bar thos par 'gyur na sgra gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gling bu dang / 'khar rnga dang / rdza rnga dang / pi wang gi sgra dag kyang 'jigs shing bag @410b tsha bar thos par 'gyur na sgra gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: The sounds of flutes, kettledrums, clay drums, and lutes will be terrifying and disturbing to hear, let alone other sounds.

original: de'i sna'ang rtag tu nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sna'ang rtag tu nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: His nose will always be impaired.

original: des rdzas dri zhim po dag kyang mi tshor ro //
analyzed: des rdzas dri zhim po dag kyang mi tshor ro //
translated: He will not smell any pleasant substances.

original: de'i lus thams cad las kyang dri nga pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i lus thams cad las kyang dri nga pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: A foul smell will come from his entire body.

original: de'i skra dang / spu thams cad 'byi zhing de'i so dag mdog ngan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i skra dang / spu thams cad 'byi zhing de'i so dag mdog ngan par 'gyur /
translated: All his hair and body hair will fall out and his teeth will become discolored.

original: rkang pa dang / lag pa rab tu rdol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rkang pa dang / lag pa rab tu rdol bar 'gyur /
translated: His feet and hands will crack open.

original: bde ba thams cad las yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba thams cad las yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
translated: He will lose all his happiness.

original: rmi lam na lha dag gis rtag tu gtse bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rmi lam na lha dag gis rtag tu gtse bar 'gyur /
translated: In his dreams, gods will always torment him.

original: de rtag tu snying nad kyis 'dabs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de rtag tu snying nad kyis 'dabs par 'gyur /
translated: He will always suffer from heart disease.

original: de'i snying gas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i snying gas par 'gyur /
translated: His heart will split open.

original: lus rnams kyang sdug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lus rnams kyang sdug par mi 'gyur /
translated: His body will not be attractive.

original: gal te brgya la me tog dag btags na /
analyzed: gal te brgya la me tog dag btags na /
translated: If he happens to wear flowers,

original: de dag myur du rnyis par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag myur du rnyis par 'gyur /
translated: they will quickly wither.

original: de'i gos dag kyang myur du zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i gos dag kyang myur du zad par 'gyur te /
translated: His clothes will quickly wear out.

original: lus dang / gos dag bkrus kyang dri ma can du 'gyur /
analyzed: lus dang / gos dag bkrus kyang dri ma can du 'gyur /
translated: Even though he washes his body and clothes, they will become dirty.

original: glo bur du lam gol bar 'gro na 'gyel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: glo bur du lam gol bar 'gro na 'gyel bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he suddenly goes down a wrong path, he will fall.

original: de'i lus 'gyel bas nyams shing de'i lus la rma mang po 'byung bar 'gyur la yun ring pos 'tsho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i lus 'gyel bas nyams shing de'i lus la rma mang po 'byung bar 'gyur la yun ring pos 'tsho bar 'gyur /
translated: His body will be injured by the fall and many wounds will appear on his body. He will live a long time.

original: gnyid log na mgul bskams shing sad nas kyang chu 'thung ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyid log na mgul bskams shing sad nas kyang chu 'thung ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: When he sleeps, his throat will be dry. When he wakes up, he will drink water.

original: sbyin byed ma'i bus gnod par gyur pa na grong dang / grong khyer dag stong pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin byed ma'i bus gnod par gyur pa na grong dang / grong khyer dag stong pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: When the son of Sujātā is harmed, he will see the villages and cities as empty.

original: gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dag gi gzugs log par mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dag gi gzugs log par mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: He will see the forms of the planets, stars, and constellations as distorted.

original: rlung chung ngu langs pa kun dang phrad na'ang mtshon gyis btab pa lta bur drag par 'gyur /
analyzed: rlung chung ngu langs pa kun dang phrad na'ang mtshon gyis btab pa lta bur drag par 'gyur /
translated: Even if he encounters a small rising wind, it will be strong as if he were struck by a weapon.

original: me chung ngu dag gis reg na'ang sreg par 'gyur /
analyzed: me chung ngu dag gis reg na'ang sreg par 'gyur /
translated: If he is touched by a small fire, he will be burned.

original: @411a *// nyi ma'ang nyis gyur gyis tsha bar 'gyur /
analyzed: @411a *// nyi ma'ang nyis gyur gyis tsha bar 'gyur /
translated: The sun will be twice as hot.

original: zla ba'ang dro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba'ang dro bar 'gyur te /
translated: The moon will also become hot.

original: zla ba shin tu dro ba myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zla ba shin tu dro ba myong bar 'gyur /
translated: You will experience the moon to be very hot.

original: chu bsil ba thams cad kyang dro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chu bsil ba thams cad kyang dro bar 'gyur /
translated: All cool water will become hot.

original: tshal dang / nags tshal bde ba dag la 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug par mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshal dang / nags tshal bde ba dag la 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug par mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: You will see pleasant groves and forests as if they were terrifying.

original: bya'i skad snyan pa dag wa skad 'jigs pa lta bur thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: bya'i skad snyan pa dag wa skad 'jigs pa lta bur thos par 'gyur /
translated: You will hear the sweet songs of birds as if they were the terrifying cries of jackals.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dur khrod lta bur rig cing rtag tu dga' ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dur khrod lta bur rig cing rtag tu dga' ba med par 'gyur /
translated: You will perceive the entire world as a charnel ground and will always be unhappy.

original: de chang gis mchog tu dga' bar skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de chang gis mchog tu dga' bar skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: You will not experience supreme joy from alcohol.

original: ngo tsha med cing tshul med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo tsha med cing tshul med par 'gyur te /
translated: You will be shameless and immoral.

original: srang dang / bzhi mdo dag tu skye bo'i mngon sum du bshang gci byed par 'gyur ////
analyzed: srang dang / bzhi mdo dag tu skye bo'i mngon sum du bshang gci byed par 'gyur ////
translated: You will defecate and urinate in public places, such as in the streets and at crossroads.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar bzhag pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar bzhag pa /
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī of the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Fifteenth Section

original: lha thams cad kyis kyang yongs su spangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis kyang yongs su spangs par 'gyur /
translated: You will be abandoned by all gods.

original: don thams cad med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur /
analyzed: don thams cad med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur /
translated: You will be destined to lack all goals.

original: mdog tshal shing bsregs pa lta bur 'gyur /
analyzed: mdog tshal shing bsregs pa lta bur 'gyur /
translated: His complexion becomes like that of a burnt log.

original: skye bo dang / yul mi kun dang zhe 'gras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bo dang / yul mi kun dang zhe 'gras par 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes an object of hatred for all people and the local community.

original: de dag ni mnar med pa de'i mtshan ma tshe 'di la sngar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mnar med pa de'i mtshan ma tshe 'di la sngar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: These are the signs of the Avīci Hell that occur in this life.

original: de'i 'og tu de 'chi ba'i mtshan ma 'byung ba ni nyin par zla ba mthong zhing mtshan mo nyi ma mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de 'chi ba'i mtshan ma 'byung ba ni nyin par zla ba mthong zhing mtshan mo nyi ma mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: “After that, the signs of death occur: during the day he sees the moon, and at night he sees the sun.

original: rang gi grib ma mi mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi grib ma mi mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: He does not see his own shadow.

original: glo bur du sgra mi snyan pa thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: glo bur du sgra mi snyan pa thos par 'gyur /
translated: He suddenly hears unpleasant sounds.

original: de'i sna yon por 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sna yon por 'gyur /
translated: His nose becomes crooked.

original: de'i skra dang / kha spu 'dzings par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i skra dang / kha spu 'dzings par 'gyur /
translated: His hair and beard become matted.

original: thog mar rims kyis 'debs shing 'chi ba'i @411b bar du nad kyis 'debs te /
analyzed: thog mar rims kyis 'debs shing 'chi ba'i @411b bar du nad kyis 'debs te /
translated: First he is struck by a fever, and then he is struck by a fatal illness.

original: de kun nas me mdag rab tu 'bar ba lta bu'i rims kyis shin tu gdungs shing nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi lta bu ma yin pa dag gis nyam thag pa /
analyzed: de kun nas me mdag rab tu 'bar ba lta bu'i rims kyis shin tu gdungs shing nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi lta bu ma yin pa dag gis nyam thag pa /
translated: He is tormented by a fever that is like a blazing mass of fire, and he is afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases.

original: kun nas me mdag gi klung dag tu 'tshed pa na srin bu'i rigs brgyad cu dag lus dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / pags pa dang / rus pa dang / sha dang / tshil dag tu zhugs nas gnod par byed do //
analyzed: kun nas me mdag gi klung dag tu 'tshed pa na srin bu'i rigs brgyad cu dag lus dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / pags pa dang / rus pa dang / sha dang / tshil dag tu zhugs nas gnod par byed do //
translated: When they are boiled in the river of burning embers, eighty types of worms enter their bodies, their channels, their sinews, their skin, their bones, their flesh, and their fat, and harm them.

original: 'di lta ste; srin bu'i rigs brgyad cu dag la rlung brgyad cu dag gis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; srin bu'i rigs brgyad cu dag la rlung brgyad cu dag gis gnod par byed do //
translated: There are eighty types of worms that are harmed by eighty types of wind.

original: srin bu spu can la rlung spu sun 'byin gyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu kha gang la rlung dag gi rjes su mthun pas gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu sbre med la rlung mi lam 'khrul ston gyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu ra ba phye byed la rlung bzod med kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu spu can la rlung spu sun 'byin gyis gnod par byed do // srin bu kha gang la rlung dag gi rjes su mthun pas gnod par byed do // srin bu sbre med la rlung mi lam 'khrul ston gyis gnod par byed do // srin bu ra ba phye byed la rlung bzod med kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm with hair is harmed by the hair-irritating wind.🔽The worm with a full mouth is harmed by the wind that is in accord with its name.🔽The worm without testicles is harmed by the wind that shows the wrong path.🔽The worm that opens the fence is harmed by the unbearable wind.

original: srin bu rnam par rmongs byed la rlung lces brjed pa mi bzod kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu rnam par rmongs byed la rlung lces brjed pa mi bzod kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm that causes confusion is harmed by the wind that cannot tolerate the tongue.

original: srin bu med mdog byed la rlung ro bro khrid byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu med mdog byed la rlung ro bro khrid byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that causes the taste of food to be spoiled harms the worm that makes no worms.

original: srin bu 'gred byed la rlung mchin pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu 'og 'gro la rlung bshang ba steng 'gros gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu 'gred byed la rlung mchin pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu 'og 'gro la rlung bshang ba steng 'gros gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that destroys the liver harms the worm that moves in the intestines.🔽The wind that moves the feces upward harms the worm that moves below.

original: srin bu aud tid ga la rlung gzhan rgyus gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu aud tid ga la rlung gzhan rgyus gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that causes other movements harms the worm that causes the movement of urine.

original: srin bu kun rtog mthong la rlung dran pa nyams byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu kun rtog mthong la rlung dran pa nyams byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that causes the loss of memory harms the worm that sees conceptualization.

original: srin bu dri nga la rlung pags pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu dri nga la rlung pags pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that destroys the skin harms the worm of bad smell.

original: srin bu rus pa legs skyes la rlung ro bro ba 'jig byed kyis gnod @412a *//🔽par byed do //🔽srin bu kha dmar la rlung sha 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu rus pa legs skyes la rlung ro bro ba 'jig byed kyis gnod @412a *// par byed do // srin bu kha dmar la rlung sha 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that destroys the taste of food harms the worm that produces good bones.🔽The wind that destroys the flesh harms the worm that has a red mouth.

original: srin bu brtson bcas la rlung rgyags pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu brtson bcas la rlung rgyags pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The wind that destroys the fat harms the worm that is diligent.

original: srin bu gnad rgyu za la rlung rus pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu mtshon cha kha la rlung rus khu 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu gnad rgyu za la rlung rus pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu mtshon cha kha la rlung rus khu 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm that eats the vital points is harmed by the wind that destroys the bones.🔽The weapon-mouth worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the bones.

original: srin bu spu gri kha la rlung gnyer mar song gis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu spu gri kha la rlung gnyer mar song gis gnod par byed do //
translated: The razor-mouth worm is harmed by the wind that goes into the wrinkles.

original: srin bu spu med la rlung mgo skya byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu khab gdong la rlung rdul 'jig gis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu spu med la rlung mgo skya byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu khab gdong la rlung rdul 'jig gis gnod par byed do //
translated: The hairless worm is harmed by the wind that makes the head white.🔽The needle-face worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the dust.

original: srin bu spi spi dza la rlung gci ba shin tu 'jug byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu rkang med la rlung zas ldan gyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu spi spi dza la rlung gci ba shin tu 'jug byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu rkang med la rlung zas ldan gyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The sissijja worm is harmed by the wind that enters the feces.🔽The legless worm is harmed by the wind that has food.

original: srin bu bshang ba g-yeng byed la rlung so 'gas byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu bshang ba g-yeng byed la rlung so 'gas byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The feces-disturbing worm is harmed by the wind that breaks the teeth.

original: srin bu gsum byed la rlung rtse'i chu la sogs kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu gsum byed la rlung rtse'i chu la sogs kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The three-maker worm is harmed by the wind that makes the water of the top and so forth.

original: srin bu rgyu ma 'jig byed la rlung 'og tu 'gros gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu rgyu ma 'jig byed la rlung 'og tu 'gros gnod par byed do //
translated: The intestine-destroyer worm is harmed by the wind that moves below.

original: srin bu dbos byed la rlung gyen du 'gros gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu dbos byed la rlung gyen du 'gros gnod par byed do //

analyzed: srin bu gnod byed la rlung snying po 'chags byed kyis gnod par byed do //

translated: The worm great kuhaka, pig-butcher, black, and great eater is harmed by the wind that destroys the eyes, ears, nose, and tongue.🔽The worm warm-footed is harmed by the wind that destroys the bones.

original: srin bu rkang gang la rlung bad kan 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu tshigs gcod la rlung gzhungs pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu klad par rgyu la rlung sen mo gnas kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu rkang gang la rlung bad kan 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu tshigs gcod la rlung gzhungs pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu klad par rgyu la rlung sen mo gnas kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm bone-destroyer is harmed by the wind that destroys the bile.🔽The worm leg-full is harmed by the wind that destroys the phlegm.🔽The worm joint-cutter is harmed by the wind that destroys the brain.🔽The worm brain-moving is harmed by the wind that abides in the nails.

original: srin bu klad rgyas za la rlung rkang pa ngos gnas kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu klad rgyas za la rlung rkang pa ngos gnas kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm brain-consumer is harmed by the wind that abides in the sides of the feet.

original: srin bu thod par rgyu la rlung sems med byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu skra za la rlung 'byed byed kyis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu thod par rgyu la rlung sems med byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu skra za la rlung 'byed byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The worm that lives in the skull is harmed by the wind that causes the mind to be absent.🔽The hair-eater worm is harmed by the wind that separates.

original: srin bu rna rgyu la rlung 'gro ba nyams byed kyis gnod par byed do //🔽srin bu snabs 'khril rlung long bu 'jig gis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu rna rgyu la rlung 'gro ba nyams byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu snabs 'khril rlung long bu 'jig gis gnod par byed do //
translated: The ear-moving worm is harmed by the wind that weakens movement.🔽The mucus-coiling worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the ankle.

analyzed: srin bu tshil nad rgyu la rlung 'byin pa 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu kha chu 'debs @413a *//
translated: The fat-disease worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the expeller.

analyzed: la rlung tshigs 'byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu so drung za la rlung 'byin pa 'jig pa tshor med byed kyis gnod par byed do // srin bu kha chu za la rlung spro ba 'jig byed kyis gnod par byed do //
translated: The saliva-dropper worm is harmed by the wind that separates the joints.🔽The tooth-root-eater worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the expeller and causes insensitivity.🔽The saliva-eater worm is harmed by the wind that destroys the expander.
